Everything seems new and (most important) extremely clean. The front desk staff go out of their way to be helpful, and it's genuine. The lobby is modern but in gentle colors. With the hotel rooms, it's the little touches that add up. A large closet with a robe, ironing board and iron, and umbrella. The bathroom has a large tub. The furniture in the room seems new, and is comfortable. The colors are subtle and rich. My room (facing the interior) was silent day and night. Positives: Location, extreme cleanliness, reasonable price, newness and high quality of furnishings, staff. Negatives: ....I can't think of one!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Becky Jo S
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for OOW which shuts the whole area down. We did have to wait past the normal check in time, but that was because of the city being completely booked. The staff was VERY friendly and the rooms were quite nice for the $. The location is perfect for Union square or if you are in town for a convention. You are close to EVERYTHING!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: simmonsgottlieb
Reviews.Content: Great place to land when walking all over San Francisco. Wine reception and walking terrace add to the many amenities available.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Monzingo
Reviews.Content: We travel to SF every year and have stayed in many different hotels(all have been good). I couldn't get in to usual spot so tried Galleria, and was very pleased. will stay there again. The location was great. Aprox 2 blocks from Muni, 1/2 block from Claude Alley and Belden Place restaurants, next door to Crocker Galleria which has Farmer's Market,walk to Union Square, etc. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Wine in the late afternoon was a nice touch. Our room was very large with fun decor and the bathroom was also large and had the best lighting I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It.”
Reviews.Author: zippadeedoodah
Reviews.Content: Loved it all. The bright lively staff. The great bathrooms, location, price. Just felt completely renewed after only 4 days. I had been really down and I was there by myself just being myself doing what I want when I want and it was just the right place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping Central”
Reviews.Author: Brooke M
Reviews.Content: GPH is perfectly located a couple blocks off Union Square - not smack in the middle of crazy traffic, but so close you're there before you know it. It is a short walk from BART & Market St. and near Ferry Building and Embarcadero. It feels safe to walk around area at night and there are usually helpful doormen there to hail a cab or greet and welcome you back. The cafe on the corner, Bread & Cocoa, is a nice place to grab breakfast, coffee, a snack... whatever you need. Couldn't really ask for more in SF. We booked a King Deluxe room to ensure we had plenty of space. The first room they checked us into was an interior and felt claustrophobic so I rang the front desk and asked about other options - they offered an exterior room without any fuss and sent up a key right away. Very professional and courteous all around. The only thing that held this back from 5 stars for us was that housekeeping missed coming in on Saturday even though we were gone most of the day. No big deal, but just a smidge under that pure premium feel. Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: GingerSanMateo
Reviews.Content: I received an email promotion offering a great rate for a Saturday night stay during High Season Christmas shopping time at Union Square. We make appoint to stay in the city every year for Christmas! This little boutique hotel was unbelievable!! Beautifully decorated and so incredibly convenient to Union Square and dining!!! And the outdoor garden area was lovely!! Staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel! Great value for the money and a wonderful experience all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all rooms and prices with a friendly front desk”
Reviews.Author: YoPedro
Reviews.Content: I booked the Galleria Park through my conference (AGU) and was pleased with the experience. The hotel is in an excellent walkable spot with easy access to everywhere downtown. The room was quiet and comfortable though the bed cover was a bit lightweight. The front desk staff were very friendly and apparently the offered a free evening wine reception and coffee morning which was a kind gesture but didn't help me since I don't drink wine or coffee. Donuts and hot chocolate would have been better. I would stay here again. I hope this is a helpful review for you.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, friendly, clean”
Reviews.Author: dawn_coyote
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels in San Francisco for the AGU fall meeting that happens annually. I have really enjoyed every hotel I stayed in (Orchard, Omni, Seal Point Inn, Marriott) - but there is something a little more personal about the Galleria Park that I really liked. Its very covenient for the Moscone and although the room I had was quite small with not much view (just a regular Queen), I felt that I didn't need any more room than that because it was so well-put together. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. I expect to return to this one! That's a 4.8 rather than a 5 ---- clock radio didn't work and was a bit grubby.

Reviews.Title: “Small, reasonably priced, convenient, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: whichcitynow
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We have been discovering that many hotels don't even vacuum the carpet in the rooms every day, but was very delighted that this one did. The location is great, walking distance to a lot of shopping and attractions. We would definitely choose to stay there again next time when we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: pensoso
Reviews.Content: JDV hotels are my favorite and I normally stay at the Hotel Rex. This trip the Galleria Park worked better with the budget and I was happily surprised and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home”
Reviews.Author: Bart J
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel i cant say enough. I contacted the hotel weeks before we arrived & was put in contact with Galen from the front desk. We mustve exchanged about 10 emails about things to do etc. ON arrival he had bumped us up to a junior suite & had a package waiting for us at the hotel. This had maps of all the areas with areas marked where we shouldnt go. Things we could do & all sorts. Plus he advised us to buy a Muni passport which gives you unlimited travel on the various forms of public transport. This was a godsend. I wouldnt advise to drive in SF but use the various forms of transport including the streetcars & cable cars. The rest of the staff at the hotel were equally as nice constantly helping where they could. Joel who is the front desk manager even booked & printed out tickets for us for a show we were going to see in LA even though it had nothing to do with his hotel. The rooms were great too, nice big flat screen tv, clean, huge bed too. Location is perfect as you are on the doorstep of Union Square & Chinatown. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Union Square hotel”
Reviews.Author: pdxtraveler79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business, while working on lower Market Street. I typically stay at bigger chain hotels (I'm a slave to points), but decided to try this hotel given its location and reasonable price. I loved this hotel! The reception personnel were very friendly and helpful, and they willingly threw band aids at me for two days after I sliced my finger. The room itself was quite spacious, and it had a good work area with plenty of outlets, which is so rare in older hotels. The bed and linens were top notch. The bathroom was very clean, but small, as would be expected in an older hotel. I had a room that overlooked an inner courtyard, and it was very quiet. I also barely heard any noise from other rooms, which is another benefit of an older hotel with thicker walls and doors. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: haparev
Reviews.Content: I had a conference scattered over several hotels and Moscone West. I wanted to pick a hotel that wasn't on the current Unite Here boycott list. It was a little far from where I needed to be, but there were plenty of cabs and the walk wasn't bad. It was also really close to the Montgomery BART station. This hotel smells good. Any hallway that smells like eucalyptus is good by me. The price was quite reasonable considering the location. The room was compact but perfect for two of us. I mean, we were just sleeping or working there. The internet was a little slow, but hey, it was free! The room was very nicely furnished. The linens were wonderful. We asked for hypoallergenic pillows and comforter and they accommodated us. The working areas were nice, as was the tv. The bathroom was nicely redone without eliminating the cool details that showed it was originally an older hotel that had been redone. The lobby was nice and the staff were very attentive. I didn't have any time to go to the wine reception (bummer), but it looked nice. The hotel was pretty quiet. I would definitely stay here again. I would have liked to spend time drinking wine out on the terrace!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: seckam
Reviews.Content: Friendly reception and very accomodating. We arrived 2hrs earlier and was checked-in without any hassle. Great location, near BART. Everything we asked for and even more. Though room was a tad small, the cleanliness and HUGE flat screen TV made up for it. We stayed for 4 nights and was only disturbed from the street noise once. They allowed us to leave our suitcase at the premises when we checked out and left for Hawaii for a few days without any charges. This has exceeded our expectations. We would most certainly use this hotel on our future trips and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Sent here due to overbooking at adagio hotel”
Reviews.Author: clivebear
Reviews.Content: Room was small.clutered with too much furniture.... Check was ok...but wine reception going on so couldnt here a thing... Bathroom towels basic/its noisy street side... Very average...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pagavin
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and lovely room with attention to details and interesting colors. Free daily wine reception was an added plus and a nice way to meet fellow guests. Very convenient to BART, bus and sreetcar lines as well as Union Square. Big flat screen TV and radio in room. Bed very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “All around, a people pleaser!”
Reviews.Author: LoriFun-BabyBoy
Reviews.Content: Everything, and everyone, about this hotel was superb. The staff is genuinely accommodating; not it seems because they've been "trained" to do so, but because they want to. My room was nice, albeit a bit too much furniture for the space, and the bathroom was larger than most historic boutique SF hotels. Comfy beds and great pillows. The parking fee is more reasonable than other downtown hotels. If you can get an exterior room you will have more light. All around, a people pleaser!

Reviews.Title: “san francisco 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: deb g
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Galleria on our 3 nights, it was a good hotel basic and bit on the expensive side for what it was. I think if you stay in San Fran stay near the Wharf. This hotel was in the business district but close enough to walk to China Town. Staff were a bit aloof and unfriendly. If you are going to alcatraz you better prebook. We prebooked luckily as it was sold out 3 days ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Andrea M
Reviews.Content: Convenient and safe location; extremely helpful and friendly staff; great room and property.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, not-so-great room.”
Reviews.Author: cup4drw
Reviews.Content: Pros: Everyone that I met there (reception, valet, maids) was very very nice. Wine Reception was fun each night. Bed was comfortable. Price was pretty good for the location. Cons: Bathroom was a little scary - didn't really want to walk on that nasty tile in bare feet. Although wifi was free, it was actually much slower than my AT&T 3G. The worst problem was the cooling system. Even though it was brisk outside, the room was hot. Not feasible to open the window at night because of the noise. The AC was bad. It barely cooled the room. And worse yet, to run it you have to leave the curtains wide open - so the room is as bright as Times Square. Shorter curtains would fix this issue, but some genius installed full length. But overall, it is a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Second Time Was Even Better”
Reviews.Author: Samuel S
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and it is very difficult to be comfortable at somewhere other than home. The Galleria Park Hotel was that and more. The Service and the Hotel were only surpassed by the Excellent Staff. Zack and Richard might check you in and they make you feel special when you walk in the door. They are two of the best ever. The rooms are nice, clean, updated, and stylish yet comfortable. The morning coffee and tea on the Mezz Floor is a nice touch. The maids smile at you, the bellmen is happy to be there. If you have any concerns or problems (which I did not), the staff does whatever they can to make it better. Great location, near shopping, china town. Book in advance so you get in. I could only get in for two of my four nights, but thanks to Ester, I got all four nights. I have stayed there a total of 19 nights. I almost did not want to leave. If you like smaller more initmate hotels, this is for you. The Restaurant is a Tequilla Sushi Bar, with great staff as well. I have never said this before, but when I left recently, I did not want to go back home. Zack, Richard, Bina, Grant, Galen, Chris, Allen, Molly, and Joel, are the best hotel front desk staff ever. Once you stay as a guest you will know what I mean. They are actually happy to see you check in. Only had one complaint, My visit was too short, haha. I can hardly wait to go back to the city, so I can stay there once again. Thanks for an awesome guys. !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Boutique" hotel can be slang”
Reviews.Author: Beaverchamp
Reviews.Content: Yes this is a boutique hotel. Small rooms, but upgraded. There are tons of them in the city, but this one stands apart. First the staff is mostly amazing. There was one bellboy that was grumpy, but it was pouring rain so I am sure he was not happy. EVERYONE else was a dream. We stayed two nights, so we got to scope things out. The decor is art deco and fun. The street sounds were surprisingly quiet. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Galleria Park, a Joie de Vivre hotel”
Reviews.Author: denise r
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quaint. Not too large, elevator was always available. Free wine hour every night. The room was great with TV and great housekeeping staff. The best thing about the hotel was the staff. I can't say enough about the entire team. The guest registration staff were awesome. They were very helpful especially when I have never been stayed in that part of the city. They were knowledgeable and had customer service as a top priority. I would have hired any of them to take back to my place of employment. Maybe they had the Disney training but they were just awesome. They remembered my name for all 4 days of my stay. The bellboys/bellhops were awesome getting taxis, directions, and eating tips. Can't say enough good things about the hotel and staff. I will only stay there when I come back to the city. The hotel should have a 4 star rating on Travelocity not a 3 and 1/2 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Do you like nice bathrooms?”
Reviews.Author: SKim78
Reviews.Content: Then this isn't the place for you. But other than the less-than-perfect bathrooms the rest of the hotel is lovely. The good: Great location for business or pleasure Great wine reception in evening and coffee in morning Staff is superb Beds are comfy The bad: Just one bad but as someone who likes a nice bathroom this one is a deal breaker for me. The bathroom in my room was just a small dingy shower stall and toilet and the sink was in the bedroom area. In my colleague's room she had a proper 4 piece bath but the bath is in dire need of replacing or at least a recaulking and her bedroom area was a much tighter space than mine.

Reviews.Title: “M & S .....Nice place”
Reviews.Author: susan w
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to San Francisco and our stay at Galleria Park made our trip complete. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable and the staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. The wine reception late afternoon allowed us to meet guests from all over the world. The convenient location and close proximpy to major transport an added plus. Our next visit to San Fransico will include The Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheChavelas
Reviews.Content: The GP is a hidden gem in the heart of San Francisco's financial and tourist districts. I am a native of the area and appreciate all that this hotel offers, which is quintessential San Francisco. The service here is provided by the best staff around, who will greet you by name and a legitimate friendliness you won't find anywhere else. I love this place and just keep coming back. I post this recommendation with only one concern: the GP gets so popular that they won't have a room available for me.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: regdawn
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel not expecting much, but to our surprise was amazed. From the very second I walked in the door I was impressed with the extremely friendly staff. The room was very nicely furnished and had a great feel, it is close to all major transport and tourist activities. You must talk to Joel on the front desk for tips on things to do in the city he is just fantastic and will bring a smile to your face he couldn't be any friendly as were all the staff Zac at the concierge has great dining options. You must have breakfast at Sears on Powell St just a short walk away and you must ride a bike over the Golden Gate Bridge. The staff at The Galleria Park were much better than the Bellagio in Las Vegas which was a total let down after our stay at the Galleria Park.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AussieKC03
Reviews.Content: Sleep Quality: Beds were comfortable with good pillows. Given the city centre location, room was mostly quiet from street noise. Bathroom: Functional, with shower over bath. Good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Plenty of clean towels supplied. Food: Complimentary wine and cheese tasting in the lobby was great. Location: Good location within easy walking distance from BART station. Easy 10mins walk to the Port of San Francisco. Near to So-Ho and the financial district. Service: accommodating staff on reception. Value for money: A double room with 2 queen beds was £200 per night. Compared to other places I’ve stayed at around the world, this was very expensive however seemed good value for money when compared to similar properties in San Francisco. Other: Good, clean hotel and would recommend for a stay in San Fran. Free wi-fi in room.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: travelin_fu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night. The room was representative of an old fashioned hotel. The room was small with the King bed and the bathroom was small as well. However, there was a lot of charm in the place and was a very good value. The hotel is convenient to all San Fran has to offer. I will probably stay here again as it was the best value in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations”
Reviews.Author: tiggywiggy210
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Galleria Park for three nights in September 2011. The hotel was excellent - the staff (from front desk, to bellman, to cleaning staff) was professional and greeted me everytime I saw them. The rooms were modern and well-made up, and check-in/check-out was quick and painless.

Reviews.Title: “Galleria Park Hotel - a piece of quiet in the fuss”
Reviews.Author: Idan H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Galleria Park Hotel for 4 nights during October of 2011. I had a GREAT time there for several reasons: The rooms - the rooms are very clean, fairly large and the beds are very comfortable. The amenities in the bathroom are superb, and the bathroom itself is very good and clean. The location - the location is very good. You go down to the street, and you see plenty of restaurants, bars and other places to hang out. The Union Square is just 3 minutes walk, as well as other tourist attractions and transportation (Muni, Bart etc.) The Staff - This hotel probably has the best staff I have personally seen in my entire trip. They treat you as if you were a customer who got the most expensive suite in the hotel and this is wonderful. They helped me a great deal when I needed them and they were very nice. The valet guys are also very nice and they get your car ready up ahead if you give them a call. Moreover, this hotel offers wine tasting every day between 4pm to 6 pm if I'm not mistaken. This is a very nice event and you get to know nice people. At the bottom line, I will surely pay this hotel another visit when I'm in town and will definitely recommend it to everyone who appreciate a good smile first thing in the morning. Thank you Galleria Park Hotel

Reviews.Title: “The best!!”
Reviews.Author: Edinburgh___70
Reviews.Content: This place is brilliant! It’s very central, the rooms are fairly large, very clean and the staff are extremely helpful. The hotel isn’t too large, it has a small gym and free wi-fi in the rooms. Complementary coffee is served every morning, and wine on an evening. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: TheMightyLaz
Reviews.Content: I was joining the Oracle OpenWorld conference and chose to stay at Galleria Park Hotel. And I liked it. Very nice and helpful staff together with clean, comfortable rooms (and a comfortable bed!) made my stay pleasant. Breakfast wasn't included but there were several places serving breakfast around the corner. Unfortunately the prices were significantly higher than usual due to the conference week but I cannot blame GP for it, since all hotels are doing the same. On the other hand is the location just 8 min walking distance from Moscone Center. And it's also close to BART. To summarize: I definitively recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience.”
Reviews.Author: Dman141
Reviews.Content: We were in SF for the Nike Women's Marathon and wanted to stay near union square. The Galleria offered the best value for the location. Once there, we were pleasantly surprised. The building is wonderful, the service was excellent and the location was perfect. Close enough to all the action but far enough from all the noise. They even accommodated for us with an early checkin and late check-out because of the race. Overall it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: jennNC02
Reviews.Content: Everything was clean, staff was friendly and everything looked exactly as we expected from photos. Only minor complaint is that it took a long time for the bellman to handle our bags twice. Other than that I give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Seattlequester
Reviews.Content: The Galleria Park is a small hotel between the Financial district and the Union Square areas. It's also around the block from Chinatown and the 'French' block. Great location that's not dead at night but also isn't noisy. The rooms are small but I've seen a lot worse in SF and unlike some places, the bathroom doesn't require contortions to enter and use. Place was quite clean also. My room didn't have a view but it still got plenty of light. Good choice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great bed Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Leah E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are big fans of the Joie de Vivre hotels- they are boutique oriented in the best sense, without being mismanaged, too small or dirty. Galleria Park had a great discount (I also recommend signing up for JdV's free members emails because they offer great deals) going and we were happy to take advantage of it. It was in a perfect location and in a very nice part of SF. The room was nice (not huge, but not many in SF are huge anyway) but very clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff was extremely welcoming and helpful- helped us find places to eat and also get us cabs when necessary. We would definitely go back again next time.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good location and wonderful staf”
Reviews.Author: Rick P
Reviews.Content: spent 4 nights here, staff truly was interested in making our stay a nice one from the valet parking to the final checkout. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macvilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the 2nd time in 12 mths. Good service from arrival to departure. Comfortably rooms with all the needed facilities. Wine service in lobby was a nice touch. Bell boys very attentive. Lots of bars and restaurants in the area and very close to union sq. Can recommend pachino pizzeria 318 Kearny st only 3mths old at this time. If you want a nice comfy hotel with good service this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon H
Reviews.Content: I work in the city often, and had to take a last minute trip this weekend. I generally stay at Hilton family hotels, just because they're reliable, but they were booked, so I checked TripAdvisor and saw the good reviews for GP...and I'm happy to add one! --The rates were comparable to a Hliton chain hotel --The location was amazing (a few blocks from BART, Union Square, tons of coffee and restaurants) --Service was top notch--I called the front with a request, and it was delivered within five minutes --Rooms are small, but modern and VERY comfortable --Park on the third floor...random but quaint touch! Thank you, GP. I'll be back ASAP!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Hari55
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this boutique hotel. Excellent friendly and knowledgeable staff. Very handy to Market Street, Union Square and China Town. Free wine tasting in the late afternoon brought guests togeather in the lobby which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: DawninDallas
Reviews.Content: Centrally located for working in the Financial District. Service is great, and the Park on the 3rd floor provides a great place to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: JCfromLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Union Square and great restaurants. Loved the boutique style. The space is adequate although some will say that it is small for an american standard but I care more of the comfort and cleanliness of the hotel. This one is definitely clean!!! The staff are friendly and helpful so will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Matt N
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and the room and the service was excellent! Everyone was super friendly and welcoming and we were very pleased not only with the spacious room we were in but also the wonderful location. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mitch s
Reviews.Content: Had a great nights stay the the Galleria Park Hotel. The staff was friendly, helpful amd efficient. The room was nicely appointed and stocked with little ammenities that you don't often see at hotels anymore. Close to Downtown ChinaTown and plenty of places to see from this central location. I would love to stay there again! GREAT JOB

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service, great location”
Reviews.Author: callipsau
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my friend for my birthday (the second part of the trip after staying at the New Yorker), and loved this hotel. It is a boutique hotel so the rooms are smaller, but the service was wonderful. We hadn't booked for a trip to Alcatraz and the guy on reception recommended to line up early in the morning when we wanted to go to see if we can get cancellation tickets (which we did). they recommended where to go around San Francisco and they were wonderful in arranging an early check in as well as a late check out at no extra cost. The hotel is pretty much around the corner from the shopping street and because me and my friend like walking, it is about 45mins from Fisherman's Wharf (it is VERY hilly at times). The room was very clean, although like I said on the small side, the bathroom was clean as well. I would stay here again if I came back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Galleria Park about 6-7 times over the last couple of years. The Galleria Park is my first choice when visiting San Francisco. The hotel is clean and staff personnel are very professional and helpful. The nightly wine reception is very nice. Conveniently located a couple blocks from Union Square, China Town and North Beach. We walk up through China Town, North Beach and down to the Warf; a great way to experience San Francisco. Plenty of nearby places to eat, drink, shop and be merry. Onsite underground parking is available as well. If you’re coming in from SFO or OAK, simply take the BART to the Montgomery station; two blocks up and one block over and you’re there. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, nice area, great staff”
Reviews.Author: JasonCarr
Reviews.Content: stayed here on a business trip. evening wine reception was fun. would definitely stay here again given the chance. House car was available to return to the airport and cost less than a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great wine reception every evening!”
Reviews.Author: Redd_10
Reviews.Content: This was a nice surprise to arrive at the Galleria Hotel as we booked on line and did not know what to expect. The staff were exceptionally polite and available to assist. The wine reception was a nice touch --a great way to meet other travellers, to unwind from the day, or to taste the great Californian wines. The location was great, safety was not an issue either. I would definately recommend this hotel to all my family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel Close to Union Square”
Reviews.Author: screennamesf
Reviews.Content: This is a small 8-floor hotel only 2 blocks from the heart of Union Square shops. I chose a junior suite which had a separate small bedroom (with tv) and a living room (also with a tv) as well as a shower/bathtub bathroom done in white marble. Pretty much everything in the room was virtually spotless. The king size bed was very comfortable and clean. The living room had a loveseat and arm chair that were both comfortable to sit in and a glass top dining table where I was able to get some work done - their wi-fi is free throughout the entire hotel. There is also an outdoor area on the 3rd floor where you can apparently get coffee, smoke, read or go jogging too. The hotel offers room service through their Japanese restaurant in the lobby-although it closes on Sunday nights. The front desk staff was also helpful and friendly enough. The Union Square location is great for avid shoppers and theater goers, although others might find the area a bit dull, especially on weekends. If you decide to stay here make sure to ask about the "donation" you'll be making to some Asian Women's Center, which is a $1/per day donation that will be added to your bill. I'm sure they mentioned this to me and I just forgot or something...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtogarden
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Nice room (very clean), great bed linens, towels. The mattress and pillows were wonderful. We asked for a quiet room and got one. Very friendly staff. Loved the wine tasting. Can't think of anything bad to say about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Galleria Park Hotel, a hidden gem in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: real_traveller2009
Reviews.Content: I decided to write this review, first and foremost, because of the entire staff working there. They REALLY bring a new meaning to the word friendly... everybody, from the minute we got off the car for the valet parking to our departure at the frontdesk was super helpful and amicable. They really deserve a great review and it's because of them that I decided to write today. I travelled with my mom, my aunt and cousin. We all got double rooms with double beds. Theirs (the older ladies) was a bit bigger and definetely made you feel better. Ours wasn't bad at all, but a little bit of more space couldn't hurt (although it would be very difficult since the hotel is build from the structure of a victorian house or mansion ...) The hotel lobby is really nice, smells good and has nice design furniture. They offer a VERY fun thing on the weekends: free wine and appetizers in the afternoon, so it gets full of guests and people ready to explore the city and make new friends. It's a cool little thing that youngsters and adults will enjoy for sure!!! The rooms are very clean and well mantained. The beds are OK (but then again, my bed back home is top notch, so I kinda of miss it everytime I travel) and the linens are comfortable. The pillows could definetely use a revamp (they sink too much, so for those who prefered a big plush pillow, it ain't happening). Overall the experience of sleeping in those rooms was very comfortable and quiet (something we didn't expect in downtown SF). We loved the selection of channels and that of the mini bar (we raided it!!! i don't recall EVER pigging out so much from a hotel's minibar lol) They have an in-room Nespresso machine that you really appreciate in the morning. The furniture is modern and yet classical, and it makes the overall look of the room really soothing and elegant. The hotel is very well appointed, a few blocks away from both Union Square and the Financial District. We had our breakfast 3 out of 3 mornings at the hotel's Hecho Restaurant next door, and we had our first dinner there. Hecho is a mix of japanese and mexican style (they serve sushi and tequila!!!) and we enjoyed it VERY much. The people were awesome and the food for both, breakfast and dinner was great. The people at the front desk are very well trained, patient and exude friendliness as i already said. Overall, a very nice experience in SF, and i shall definetely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Jewel of a Find and wish Galleria was everywhere in the US”
Reviews.Author: Wendy R
Reviews.Content: Galleria is a pretty boutique hotel with every detail that fits perfect for a well seasoned traveller. The amenities they offer end up saving you a lot of money. From the high quality coffee served every morning to the wine reception every night. The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful to get you around San Francisco and experience what this great city have to offer. I wholeheartedly would stay here without hesitation. In fact, this would be my first pick.

Reviews.Title: “Our first visit to SF in 30 years, and will return to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JGC11
Reviews.Content: The service is fabulous, witht the front desk even offering to run a package up to my room for me when we were late for the tour bus! The hotel is charming, very clean, great decor, and best of all wonderful bed and bedding for a sound night's sleep. Location is great, walk to Union Square easily, Chinatown, the financial district, a block and a half to Market Street trolley, and the Ferry Building is 15-20 minute walk. On the first day we just kept walking from the ferry building to fisherman's wharf, and it was so much busier there we realized our location suited our sleepier style better. We were on the 3rd floor and did not hear any street noise, but did have the fan on to be sure. If anything, our room with a king bed was a tad small, but perfectly comfortable, and for all we know, par for the course in this compact city. Plus plenty of breakfast places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, with delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: Anthony M
Reviews.Content: This was mine and my partner's first trip to San Francisco, and it was made all the better because we chose to stay at this hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and we were always made to feel welcome. The drinks in the lobby every evening were a nice touch. The room was always cleaned to a high standard by the housekeeping staff. The room itself was large, with a bath in the bathroom, and very nice decor (I especially liked the writing desk, nice touch!). It was in a good location in SF, which is mostly quite safe (as safe as you can be in this city, where good neighbourhoods are always bordered by bad neighbourhoods). I would go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated historic hotel in shopping and business district”
Reviews.Author: jslai0612
Reviews.Content: Modern, contemporary design. Near designer shops on Post street, Union Sq, Powell St. cable cars, Westfield shopping mall and up-scale food emporium. Also among many office buildings and their food courts. Exceptional staff.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceded all the reviews posted.”
Reviews.Author: slimnlm
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel I will be recommending to family and friends when staying in San Francisco. The location was great. Hotel staff excellent. I wish the Joie de Vivre Hotels were in every city I visit. The Room was plenty big enough for a family of 3.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service. Warm friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bjandthebear
Reviews.Content: I had a few issues, but the customer service and customer focus from the Joie de Vivre group is second to none and all taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Scott C
Reviews.Content: We were warmly greeted upon our arrival and received great recommendations for places to go in Chinatown. The room was adequately sized, newly refurnished, and completely met our needs - a comfortable landing pad between our outings. They have free wine between 5:30-6:30 pm each day, and there is a good restaurant attached - it is a sushi place, but has good breakfast at a reasonable price that was very convenient on the way out each morning. Our room was on the outside part of the hotel, so street noise was a bit disturbing during the night, but we were so exhausted from our outings and walking the hills of San Fran that we hardly noticed. However, if going back, I would probably ask for a room on the interior - views of the buildings across the street are not worth the noise. Also, 3rd floor is the pet floor which we were on - we heard a few barks in the morning, but nothing during the night, etc. Not an issue from my perspective, but again, good info if you want to avoid any possible noise. Highly recommend the place - great value, prime location within 2 blocks for Market St. where BART and MUNI run - so public transportation was easy to get to. All-in-all, we had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price for a major city, good location.”
Reviews.Author: PSWPharmD
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel for my annual Father - Daughter trip that I take with my dad. The pros include a courteous and informative front desk staff, including the bellhops. Convienient location to BART, about 2 blocks from the Montgomery St. Station. It was walking distance to Union Square and Chinatown and a $10 cab ride to the Fisherman's Wharf. The decor is modern and attractive, but the rooms w/ 2 double beds are small. I only saw my room, so I don't know about space in the other room types. We had a slight plumbing issue - toilet kept running and sink drained very slow. We reported the issue and someone came to fix it very quickly. No problems after that. I missed the free wine hour, but I did have the complimentary coffee in the morning. I feel like I probably shouldn't complain about it, since it's free, but I really didn't like the hotel blend of coffee. Sorry, I'm a big coffee drinker, I wish there was a wider variety to choose from, but hey it was free. The beds were really soft, I loved the pillows. Overall, I had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SoleilCanada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here and would definitely stay here again. The location is excellent, the bed was very comfortable and the hotel is very stylish. The free wine at cocktail hour was an excellent touch. There was some street noise to contend with as our room had a window to the street and we were on the third floor. I am sure we would have been moved to an interior room on an upper floor if we had asked but we were not really bothered by it. The staff were very professional, friendly and helpful and our room was VERY clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful 100 year old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kingscory
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience. Will stay again for sure. Although expensive, it's probably the least expensive hotel in the neighborhood. Walking distance to bars, restaurants, cable cars, AT&T park, market street, union square... Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel.. very central & close to the BART station. The room was a bit small and I guess its not as modern as some hotels, but still very pleasant to stay in. The staff were helpful & aimed to please. Would recommend this place to anybody visiting San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “A real find.”
Reviews.Author: PasadenaRose7
Reviews.Content: The Galleria Park is an older hotel that has been very nicely rehabbed and updated. Because of their age, the rooms are a little smaller than in modern hotels; however, they are very attractive and comfortable, with up to date bathrooms. If you arrive by BART, the hotel is only a five-minute walk from the station. I was in town to see a couple of museum exhibits, and was very pleased to discover that SFMOMA and the Contemporary Jewish Museum, not to mention the Yerba Buena Center, also were only a five-minute walk away, just south of Market. There is a nice little bakery and cafe next door where I got a good casual lunch and breakfast. The hotel has an outdoor "park" on one of its roofs, and that provided a nice place to relax after a busy day in the City. As an added bonus, I found a promotional code at www.retailmenot.com that saved me about $38 per night. I definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jilltimestwo
Reviews.Content: This was a lovley hotel in an art decor style. Lovely room, comfortable bed and hot shower. We were able to walk to lots of locations and the housekeeping was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, an enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: roughout
Reviews.Content: We were back in town for two nights and gave GP a try. Check in was fast and the room was comfy. Sheets and towels were comfortable and the bed was a good nights rest. Room was a little cramped for two but if you're not in the room that much it works. They have a wine tasting in the afternoon but it's a little too popular so we steered clear. Room service was pretty dismal, they were out of everything we asked for and we gave up and went out for breakfast. The coffee maker in the room was very odd. A Keurig, which we have at home, so we knew how to use it. Thing is they give you these tiny cups that will overflow if you follow the directions as listed on the device. I suggest only filling it with the cup provided to avoid the flood we had. My biggest complaint would have to be the valet. We dropped the car off on arrival and took it out the second night to meet old friends for dinner. It took a good 30 minutes to get our car because the valet was MIA after taking someone else's car. When we returned from dinner I waited another 30 minutes for the valet before going to the front desk to ask them to locate the guy. He walked up like nothing was wrong so needless to say a tip was not offered. Great location for getting around town whether by cab, public transit or car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: NurseChristie
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, this hotel is very well located in the downtown core. It is perfect if you are travelling for business, or if you are interesting in shopping in the tony Union Square area! The hotel has a modern, yet warm decor, with blue, green, and silver tones. The rooms were cozy, as one would expect in a boutique hotel, but were well appointed. The lobby has a great fireplace and lounge area, perfect for enjoying the complementary wine hour in the evening. They have other great complimentary perks, including tea and coffee in the mornings, as well as Wi-Fi and newspapers. We were very pleased to be checked-in several hours before the standard time, and the staff were very helpful when we needed them. The most exciting aspect of the hotel is that it is Green-certified, incorporating many green practices into its operation, including the use of environmentaly friendly cleaning products!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service, average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Ashoppersemail
Reviews.Content: JOEL, JOEL, JOEL! the key to our vacation was the superior customer service we received by our personal city entertainment coordinator. He knew the must see, must shop and must eats of san Fransisco. While the hotel left something to be desired in the area of luxury and serenity, they did provide us with out treasured Joel. He was able to predict the likes and dislikes of veteraned san Fran visitors. He opened our eyes to new places and reminded us of treasured old haunts. While the room rate was not exorbadent it was acceptable for the value it offered. Bottom line: customer service A+, accommodations C+.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it, I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: flacaSandra
Reviews.Content: Stayed for work but I would return to the Galleria Park in SG for pleasure. Older place with swanky swank decor, very friendly staff & complimentary wine hour? I'm in. In the city? I work at a nonprofit so the prices must've been a good price. No its not the 4 Seasons or the Ritz but I am not comparing it to those - this is a boutique hotel as a boutique should be. Pros- Good location in the Financial District, 1 block from the Bart @ Montgomery. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. I for one loved the tall shower heads - thanks from the Girls 5'9 & over club! Stylish Decor Complimentary Wine Hour Pet friendly! Cons- No view - but you're in San Francisco, why are you in your room anyway? Go get a meal & drink! And take a walk! Rooms are small but I thought it was fine. TV are old... maybe some flat screens would open the rooms up? I'll be back for work and pleasure! If you'd rather save some cash for a nice meal & drinks, I recommend the Galleria Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTraveler2
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get this hotel through the Priceline bid system, because I've been curious about the Joie de Vivre hotels. It looks like they basically take distressed properties, completely renovate them, and make them available as hip hotels. In this case, I'm guessing that the bathrooms, furniture, carpeting, and paint are entirely new and that they were able to keep some trim (e.g., what's around the doors), making for a nice mix of reused elegance. The location is fantastic, close to both tourist and business San Francisco. (And close to mass transit - BART and Muni - as well.) The size of a room was typical for hotels in this area, which is to say not large, but it had plenty of space with the bed, nightstands, large dresser, flat screen TV, desk, closet, and bathroom. The complimentary coffee was quite good, and the (unaffiliated) cafe downstairs was also quite good. A setting like this can get noisy, but that was a non-issue during our stay. It's the type of place I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DogWalker16
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel has no frills about it, it is very clean, the staff were very friendly and very helpful and the location is excellent. If you are looking for somewhere central to Union Square and don't spend a lot if time in your hotel it is perfect. The rooms whilst a little small are clean and have everything you need for your stay. The price was quite good value, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SamVancouver
Reviews.Content: Sorry for a negative review without actually staying at the hotel. However, fair is fair . This is my first negative experience with a hotel property and I must pass it on. I booked a four night stay for the end of December for four nights at $110 per night. My wife and I are crazy about SF and always plan an annual trip way in advance! However, I also mentioned to the reservation clerk that Expedia.ca had a rate of $77 a night and whether she would match it. She guided me to their website where I could fill in a price match form. No problem. After I received my confirmation number I filled out the online form and was instructed I would hear from them within 48 hours. I did notice that they would only price match US dollars but with the Cad.$ being higher I didn't care about the difference. To shorten the story, 10 days later and after numerous calls and emails....I found that the original rate of $110 per night was in fact for three nights and the last night being NY's Eve was going to be $309! No one bothered to get back to me about the price match. The last communication was with Esther [--], their reservation specialist who while being apologetic basically told me to book with Expedia. So you may ask why don't I just do that and save this hassle? I always like to book with the hotel directly and have never ever been turned down for a price match. My beef is just basic communication. I don't mind being turned down but let me know. Too bad, I am sure the Galleria would have been a nice stay but we'll never find out because I am sure they don't want business from people like me.

Reviews.Title: “An okay stay”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveller4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 3 blocks from Union Square -- a good location with many restaurants and shopping nearby. We took the BART at the SFO airport ($8.10 per person) and got off at the Montgomery St. Station. If you have heavy suitcases, there is an elevator to street level -- look for the Sutter and Sansome exit sign. From this elevator, it is a two-block walk along Sutter Street to the hotel. The hotel is an older building with a modern decor. Our family of three stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. Free internet access in the room. Comfortable beds. Tall ceiling. The bathroom was VERY small -- no counter, just two small shelves (each about 20" wide) located above the toilet. These shelves were used to hold a spare roll of toilet paper, small bottles of shampoo, conditioner and lotion, and 2 glass cups. So not much room remaining for my own toiletries. The tissue box sat on top of the toilet. The hairdryer was stored in a cloth bag hanging above the toilet. In order to put on my makeup, I had to squeeze in between the toilet and the sink to get up close to the wall mirror (I'm near-sighted). The bath towels hanging on the bars were almost touching the toilet. Only one hook in the bathroom -- had to use the door handle to hang my pyjamas while changing. There is complimentary tea and coffee in the morning from 5-10 am on the mezzanine level -- nothing for kids who do not drink coffee or tea. One morning, the tea and coffee was taken away by 9:45 am. When we asked the front desk clerk about this, he was not apologetic and seemed somewhat bothered when we requested coffee and tea -- it was not 10:00 am yet so we felt that it was a reasonable request. We did get the coffee and tea. The hotel has a garden terrace located on the third floor for relaxing and for walking/jogging. It was listed on a plaque in their elevator. When we went to check it out on Sunday, we found that it was closed on Sundays. Complimentary wine is served in the early evening. We did not take advantage of this since we're not wine drinkers. We have stayed at other boutique hotels where other types of drinks are offered (beer, pop, juice) during their social hour, and younger family members could join in. Overall, it was an okay stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: margritss
Reviews.Content: I was here on business twice, in April and in June. I was treated very well each time. I wasn't wild about the first room I was given the first time around and I knew I would be there 3 nights. I went back to the front desk and inquired as to the availability of a better room and they were so nice in accomodating me.The staff were all exceedingly polite and helpful. I would stay there again as well as recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Dmiller72
Reviews.Content: I stay here often for business and have always been very satisfied with the rooms and the service. The front desk people are always friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit quirky and the furniture is slightly funky - it's not your typical hotel room. Each room seems to have unique dimensions and layouts due to the age of the building. Some of my fellow business travelers have complained about the noise, but it is in downtown San Francisco, so some noise is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ka51
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Galleria Park Hotel was wonderful. It's a boutique hotel that is perfectly located to everything you need and want to do in San Fran. It's a place that offers a charming and intimate environment with the kindest, modt helpful staff you will ever meet. You never feel crowded or overwhelmed like you do in a larger hotel but you still have all the amenities and then some. The evening wine tasting,the outdoor walking/jogging track and the 24Hr Fitness center next door made it the perfect place for me. Chinatown and every store you could want to shop at are very near. I look forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service for a meeting”
Reviews.Author: srtravels4work
Reviews.Content: I worked with the Galleria Park to schedule a meeting for a group of 35 people. They were great to work with and made everything very easy--scheduling the room, catering orders, AV. All was taken care of by talking with one person who was very responsive. Excellent value and our group will be back. Also great central SF location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: nancy354
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I came to San Francisco for a short summer fun trip. We LOVED the Galleria Park. First off, one has to realize this is an older hotel and accept a few quirks in the spaces, but then appreciate the charm of, eg, the elegant marble staircases connecting all the floors. The room we had was spacious, for an older building, with 2 queen beds. The bathroom space was adequate as there were shelves on which to place toiletries while using the sink/mirror. Our shower head gave less than vigorous stream of water, but we made do. The cleanliness was of an excellent standard. Loved the linens and Frette terry robes! Beds were comfy, but noise from windows of our outside room was a bit troublesome. We were on the 4th floor, facing the street. Saturday night was the worst, with noisy night owls in the street. I think you should do all you can to get an upper floor or inside room. (We had requested that when making the reservations, but it must not have been available when we checked in.) The 3rd floor roof terrace was a lovely space in which to sit with a coffee and read or make a phone call. The staff were wonderful, from front desk to bell staff to housekeeping. Very friendly and ultra-accommodating. (And very likely may have found us another room had we asked.) The location at Sutter and Kearny, just north of Market, can't be beat for being close to Union Square without being right on it, with the hassles of the crowds there, and for easy access to BART for connection to airport, East Bay, other locations as well as all the Muni bus routes running along Market. It's an easy, 10-15min walk to Ferry Building for ferries to Sausalito, etc. As for dining, we did not use the attached Japanese restaurant, but did use the breakfast cafe right next door, which was good (but limited menu, mostly drinks and pastries) and there are dozens of choices within a quick walk. My husband and I have visited San Fran several times, staying at the bigger hotels, but I am now sold on this one. The amenities are as good or better and the warm, friendly staff are the best I've encountered. I'm excited to have discovered this lovely gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Love my stay and will definitely be coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Dona T
Reviews.Content: Loved the services by front desk, Joel and Pete - they made all the difference between an acceptable hotel stay against a terrific stay! They have been very accommodative, particularly as I'd to arrange for deliveries back to my home.Whilst the bathrooms can be a little small, as commented numerous times by other reviews, the location, free wifi and happy hour is unbeatable. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Doggie Friendly, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: garlicpaige
Reviews.Content: If you have a dog, book an interior room on the 3rd floor. They have a third floor, secure garden area where leashed dogs are welcome to be walked. I enjoyed the Art Deco hotel everyone was very helpful, from the staff receiving at the door to the knowledgeable front desk staff. The front desk staff graciously arranged for us to have dinner in front of the fireplace in the lobby. Our dinner was from Hecho, which serves a Japanese menu. Our meal was tasty, and the servers came out from the restaurant to take our order in the lobby with our dog in eager attendance.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: janfouroneone
Reviews.Content: GPH is near everything. Lovely rooms. The inside facing rooms are darker, but more than adequate lighting. Very quiet. The 3rd floor terrace is a nice perk. Really welcoming check-in. Would stay again. Had breakfast at Hecho, but never tried the sushi/tequila pairings.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: SF_William
Reviews.Content: * Free WIFI and wired network * Location, location, location! only a few blocks from Chinatown and union square, there's a lot of really good restaurants all around the place (just check on Yelp!) * Roof terrace on the 3rd floor is great and opens on to the galleria park next door which has a few restaurants and some shopping. Make sure you go through to the other roof terrace on the opposite side of the gallery for a nice view of Market street. * Staff is incredibly friendly and helpful All in all, this is definitely a place I would go back to!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, nice hotel and room.”
Reviews.Author: CA7777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect loaction for seeing San Francisco, day and night. I felt safe coming back alone to the hotel late at night. Clean and well-appointed room, with attention to detail. The lobby was fun -- nice place to sit and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adsofox
Reviews.Content: My family and I had only one night in San Fran and we chose to spend it at Galleria Park upon the recommendation of a friend. we thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. Great location. Immacualte and spacious room and very cool and eclectic ambience. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: headednorth
Reviews.Content: great location, friendly staff, nice room,appealing price

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: margaritacartas
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru Priceline and i had never heard of the Galleria Park. I want to say that this was a GREAT FIND. This is a boutique hotel in an AMAZING location. We were within walking distance to (less than 2 to 3 blocks), Chinatown, Unionsquare,the FerryBuilding and downtown. The hotel is magnificent, its staff is the friendliest and most accomodating, the rooms are clean and it has the most amazing boutique decor, as well as the most comfortable bed. They serve complimentary wine everyday in the lobby, which is very nice. I travel to San Francisco several times a year because my daughter works there and i look forward to my next trip and my next stay at the Galleria Park.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Dgabelnater
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and well appointed. The service from the front desk was very nice. The complimentary wine tasting at 5:00 was a nice touch and welcome after a day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Happy to have stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: KingBenny78
Reviews.Content: When travelling, the hotel location is the most important thing to us and the Galleria Park is fantastic for that reason. It is an older hotel which gives it that charm. The staff is friendly and helpful. It is located to close to all the transportation you need including the BART to the airport which is only a block away. It is close to the cable cars, union square, 15 min walk to the Ferry Building, right by Chinatown/North Beach, etc. We also attended a Giants baseball game which was about a 20 minute easy flat walk from the hotel. There is some street noise at times but this is normal for a downtown hotel. It did not bother us. I highly recommend staying here if you are looking for a clean and comfortable hotel in a great location. The Japanese restaurant within the hotel is also quite good - fantastic quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Hotel, Great Employees”
Reviews.Author: Arsunstrom
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, centrally located and employees were full of great suggestions and very knowledgeable. Room was clean and decorated great, a little small would be my only complaint if I had to make one. In the middle of everything. Hopefully will be back one day

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: LaurenKyle
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful; very art deco. The staff were very friendly and happy to answer any questions. Small beds (double) but heard that is normal around San Fran. Parking is very difficult to find parking (at a reasonable price). We used the valet hotel parking at $35+tax a day. Expensive, but at par for the city. My only complaint is the dent and white car paint that was put into the passenger side door of my less than 2 year old grey car. Unfortunately we didn't notice until we got out at the Golden Gate Bridge and it was too late to go back. So, if you don't need to park there, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff. Room itself is less attractive”
Reviews.Author: smoshe
Reviews.Content: I stay at the hotel for a convention with two colleagues. My room was the smallest and the sink was at the main room rather than in the shower (?). the room was clean and bed is comfortable. Location is superb and staff attention is great. Overall a decent stay not more then that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: guv249
Reviews.Content: The property was well kept but the outstanding part of this hotel is the staff. From the welcome with the bellman to the friendly front desk staff. All off them treated us with kindness. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a good location, clean hotel and nice staff experience. Lee

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again! A beautiful, charming hotel...”
Reviews.Author: SuperCupcake
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 712, a room that overlooked the street but far enough up that street noise wasn't a problem. They offered us an inside room but, being in San Fran for the first time, I wanted to look out onto the streets, see the lights and such. No spectacular views or anything but fun to people watch from the window. The hotel location was super close to all sorts of public transportation, including only 2 blocks from the cable cars and a block from the train to get the airport. Also, just a couple blocks from Union Square shops and restaurants. A couple blocks from Chinatown and within a mile or so of The Embarcadero, where all the piers are. This hotel is at a really great central location. No need for a car in San Fran. We were here 3 nights and the front desk was super helpful and friendly helping us find open cafes late at night and pointing us in the direction of shopping and public transportation. We were gone from morning til night sightseeing so we really didn't use any of the hotel amenities. The room itself was small but very charming. And VERY clean. Oh, and great beds. So comfortable! I would 100% stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice small gem in SF financial district”
Reviews.Author: dragndrop
Reviews.Content: It is an apartment building outside, but once you walk inside the building, it starts with high class services - starting from check in desk (very friendly and helpful); Room is small, but it is sparkling clean; feels like an expensive residential apartment in Four Season's at Market x 4th Street. I will definitely go back without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: klcollins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week with my sister, while exploring San Francisco. It offered all we were looking for, and more! The hotel is very well located, just blocks from the BART train station for easy access from the airport. As well, you can easily walk to all the lovely shops at Union Square, the Ferry Building, the Cable Car turnaround, and so on. The room was very well appointed, had a safe, and had air conditioning as well as windows that opened. The fabulous hotel staff always made us feel welcomed back each time we returned from an outing, and we especially liked the wine reception in the lobby each evening! There is a lovely outdoor terrace to relax in. I liked that wireless internet access was included in the room rate, which was reasonable in comparison to similar hotels. There are restaurants and coffee shops all close by, as well as banks, shops, drug stores, and so on. We would definitely recommend Galleria Park and their staff - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staff in America”
Reviews.Author: pnosugref
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Galleria for our 9th family reunion. Previous stops included: Vegas, Myrtle Beach, New York, Boston, Toronto, Chicago, and Niagra Falls. The highlight of our stay in San Francisco was the service we recieved at the Galleria. From the moment that we arrived on Thursday afternoon until we left at 4:00 am on Monday morning the staff made us feel that we were the most important people in San Francisco. Thanks for all of your efforts.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT in every way!”
Reviews.Author: nosugref
Reviews.Content: Great location, great rooms, and the friendliest, most courteous and helpful staff of any hotel we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Accommodations in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Meticulous_One
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near Union Square, within walking distance to the best attractions in San Francisco. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. I stayed at the hotel for two nights in a room, with a courtyard view. The rooms are small and dated. Upon entering my room, I felt as if I was interred in a mausoleum crypt. The walls are very thin. The conversations of the hotel guests in the adjoining rooms were clearly heard, making it difficult to receive a good night sleep. There is one on-site restaurant with few menu options. The items in the mini-bar are extremely expensive. There are plenty of dining options in the area around the hotel. However, I was in San Francisco on a business trip so having to venture outside of my hotel room to find food, after a long work day was rather inconvenient. Overall, I am happy with my stay at Galleria Park Hotel due to the hotel’s amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed it & we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: kryzzy
Reviews.Content: ask the staff if you have enquiries & they are very helppful. felt safe staying in sf.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: smarin3
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Galleria Park. The rooms have very tall ceilings, lots of natural light, and are rather large for city standards. There's a desk, two armchairs, and a bed. The internet is free and the wine hour every evening is a great perk. The rooms and lobby have a cute decor going on, and the roof terrace is a nice little spot to read a book. Parking is valet and on par price-wise with what you'll find in the area. It is very nice to be able to take your car in and out the whole stay and only pay one price. The location is great for travelers/tourists. Close to the MUNI, to the Powell turnaround, to Union Square, the Ferry Building, and Chinatown. There are tons of restaurants within walking distance and a Walgreens on the next block. Would highly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, clean hotel with a charismatic staff”
Reviews.Author: DNP779
Reviews.Content: Ended up at the hotel somewhat randomly on a business trip and was pleasantly surprised by every aspect of the hotel--incredible value in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: chris79cvb
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay! The room was on the small side, but it was clean and comfortable. More important, the staff was incredible and went out of their way to help us. We have a baby, and it was the end of Pride weekend, so the staff gave us a 'quieter' room. They helped us with all of our needs (with a baby, this can be a lot!) and always did it with a smile and enthusiasm. We were pleased, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: KennyKet
Reviews.Content: For the price this was a smart hotel in a great location. It's near union square and not far from the main shopping centre. The rooms were spacious and the staff friendly. Particularly good was the free wine reception between 5.30 and 6.30pm and complementary coffee in the morning. It you didn't book breakfast then there is a great coffee shop on the corner of the hotel and also a 7 eleven nearby. Free WiFi too !

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: DetailsAreEverything
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great room, Great service, free parking with room rate, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient place for downtown business”
Reviews.Author: RTJDallas
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel for easy convenience and nice accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Sheets for the Money"”
Reviews.Author: Travel_pro67
Reviews.Content: A bargain is usually a trade off- Not at the Galleria Park Hotel, SF. The location cant be beat and the quality of this Boutique hotel for the rates they charge makes you feel like your robbing them ;) The complimentary architectural walking tour is not to be missed either. All in all this place is the best "sleeper" deal in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business stay”
Reviews.Author: Mdock88
Reviews.Content: The rooms are charming and beds comfortable. Large shower/tub and quiet for what seems to be an older building. Wish the fitness center was larger.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolAD
Reviews.Content: Friendly, welcoming, courteous & professional staff begin a wonderful stay. Morning & in-room coffee service, afternoon wine hour, quiet courtyard rooms, personal greetings from staff as you come & go continue to make for a first rate experience. Conveniently located to BART, Muni, cable cars, it's easy to choose public transportation & short walks to travel throughout the city. This is a special and terrific place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: vlong1
Reviews.Content: This was a first visit but I will be back. I recently reviewed The Palace, and this was such a better experience. A great rate, a great location, staff was very helpful and accommodating. Joel (front manager) checked me in and his level of helpfulness and enthusiasm was impressive for a jaded traveler like me. The property is dated but charming, bed was one of the best I've had in a hotel in a while. Bath situation is a little cramped, street noise can be pretty significant, and food options are pretty limited (sushi only, best as I could tell, though I'm not a big user of room service). But the whole experience was very good and I intend to be go back. One petty note...the staff gave a good push for their Joy of Life Club and since I have stayed at a number of Joie de Vivre properties and liked them all, I decided to sign up. Enrollment was not particularly convenient, and it turns out they will only credit stays booked directly through their web site, yet my employer requires me to book through our corporate travel site...so all that trouble to enroll and I will probably never get any points. If you're going to use a club to encourage repeat visits, it ought to be easy and encouraging, not difficult and overly restrictive.

Reviews.Title: “Galleria Park really caters to all guests - great for business travelers!”
Reviews.Author: slbharris
Reviews.Content: I travel to SFO a lot for business and Galleria Park is very accommodating! They have a great business center, and the staff will send a fax or email pdf in a real jiffy! The wine reception is great between business meetings and business dinners. The terrace garden is very relaxing to unwind. The rooms are clean and comfortable - the beds sleep GREAT. The wireless internet works fantastic. The coffee on the mezannine is the best coffee around! And the cozy fireplace in the lobby is my favorite spot!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: knevets
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Galleria Park Hotel and found it to be a wonderful experience and a pleasant place to stay – exceeding our expectations. The location was great for easy access to public transportation as well as a variety of things to see and do and great places to eat. The staff was very courteous and knowledgeable of the area. The room was cozy, clean, and quiet – and we even took advantage of their petite fitness room. Overall a great find and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TACCooke
Reviews.Content: A very nice property in central location, walking distance to subway, tram service etc. Room small but comfortable and quiet, serviced daily. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Some good restaurants nearby, great little coffee shop right next door. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: orangesmith007
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently spent 3 nights at the Galleria! They let us check in at 11am! Front staff was absolutely amazing throughout our stay; any questions/concerns we had were promptly handled. They helped us pick out places to eat, areas to try for night life and had great general knowledge of San Fran. Also Hecho, the sushi/tequila bar attached to the hotel had delicious and unique food and exceptional staff. We will definitely stay here again when we return to SF.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HannahBee123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Galleria Park for a weekend trip with my husband. We booked the Galleria Park via a Priceline bid and got a great deal. This is a great hotel. We really liked the central location and how there were shops and restaurants abound in the area. The decor of the hotel was very classy and sleek looking. Everything was very well kept and clean. The front desk staff was always friendly and attentive. Our room was small, but still comfortable. Since we booked on Priceline we didn't get to choose our room type, so the hotel put us in the smallest room type -- one double bed. I had never heard of a hotel room with only one double bed before. The room couldn't have been more than 200 square feet. It was tiny -- but very well decorated and organized so it was comfortable for us. The bed was really comfortable and the bathroom was sleek and clean. After driving through a few other areas of San Fran, I really appreciated the location of the Galleria Park. Fisherman's Warf feels like an overpriced tourist trap, and some of the other areas had sketchy parts. I also really liked the originality of this hotel and that it was not a major chain like Hilton or Radisson. It made our stay more authentic feeling, and we felt less like "tourists." A few restaurant tips -- Anderson Bakery in the galleria right next to the hotel has really good sandwiches. They are not open on the weekends though, sadly. Scala's Bistro, which is just a few blocks away, is phenomenal. We had the best meal there. I would definitely stay here again. I felt like we got an excellent value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice long weekend”
Reviews.Author: AZJess921
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at Galleria Park, and really enjoyed our stay. Everyone working in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. As other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms/bathrooms are pretty small, but the hotel is 100 years old, so you have to consider that. Our room had a king sized bed, which was very comfortable, and the other furniture/decorations were nice. There is a Keurig machine in the room and coffee is provided, so that was a nice touch. The only things I would change about the room is to maybe add a curved shower-rod (the shower was pretty tight for me, and I'm not a big person), and if they could figure out a way to add some counter space in the bathroom, it would be even better. The lobby was pretty, and it was convenient having the business center (you can print boarding passes for free). The hotel's location is very convenient to the Montgomery street BART station, so getting to the hotel from the airport was very easy. We found plenty of eating/drinking places within a few blocks, and there is a ton of shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: mirage159
Reviews.Content: Very clean, staff is professional. Had a courtyard room. No noise from street. Very small room, no natural light. Very soft mattress bed. Very clean bathroom. Renovated building. Cool lobby. Good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from staff”
Reviews.Author: Littletk
Reviews.Content: booked holiday through Expedia, after reading the excellent reviews already on trip advisor. Didnt take long to arrive from the airport after a long flight which was nice. First impressions were good, asked for a room away from the street just incase in was noisey. Room was lovely and clean, had everything that you could want. Staff were amazingly helpful at all times, asked from restuarant recommendations and got some really good ones.
