Cafe Tiramisu in Belden Street was lovely, hotel staff got as a table on a very busy Saturday night which was good. Staff even helped with bus routes and numbers to help us get about everywhere. Make sure you buy a City Pass before you go, was the best thing we bought, gets you free travel on all public transport and entrance into a few really good places. Would definatley recommend this hotel to anyone, well worth it. Thank you to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and really comfortable stay. Worth staying.close to all important transport facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Bmcguire73
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms and really comfortable stay. Worth staying.close to all important transport facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: euromalta
Reviews.Content: we stayed four nights in this hotel, clean place,nice people, close to union square, great location, they serve wine from 5:30 to 6:30pm we loved it. the people at the front desk were very helpful. we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: pennsylvaniab
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night while attending a meeting. The front desk personnel were efficient and friendly, Iand I appreciated the two newspapers of the day and the complimentary beverage. the room was well-appointed--no surprises. I have stayed at otherJoie de Vivre properties, and have found this small chain to offer fine service in excellent locations. The only service that I used was the free internet acess in the business service (20 minutes). My stay was brief, but after a long day (and short night), I appreciated the outstanding service from this excellent property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bosox1010
Reviews.Content: I went to San Fran with 3 friends for a golf trip. I picked this hotel because it has a good rating on Expedia and they gave us a free night. We were in two double/double rooms. My room was a little smaller than the other but not a huge deal considering we were barely in our room anyways. The location of this hotel can be any better, it is a half a block away from the BART, Market Street and the shopping district. The staff was very accomodating and provided great service. The Wine tasting and the free coffee in the morning is a nice touch as well. Overall a great stay in a beautiful city, would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well-located and a relative bargain.”
Reviews.Author: I-am-Edward
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, seemingly recently retooled, and VERY conveniently-located. It's basically two blocks from BART and MUNI trains. A well-reviewed sushi restaurant is adjoining. I found all the staff helpful. My top-story room was quieter than my home in another a "quiet" neighborhood in another major metropolis. I had none of the typical hotel complaints--lumpy mattress, thin walls, poor water. The mattress was firm and comfortable--it made me think I need a firmer one at home. I never heard a neighbor. And the shower was hot, responsive and more powerful than I expected in our water-challenged age. The Galleria Park is so well located that you can hop to a nearby store to pick up anything you neglected. A coffee, pastry & sandwich shop on the corner could not be more convenient. And a 7-11 less than a block away supplied me with inexpensive snacks. Last time I visited San Francisco, I stayed in a different 'boutique' hotel which had thinner walls, was further from BART/MUNI and was somewhat more cramped--for only a few dollars less per night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the heart of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: outintwenty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on a baseball trip. Very nice hotel, rooms were clean, and the staff was very attentive. They offer free wine which we only did once but it was ok. Free wifi which had no problem connecting to. Centrally located in Union Square and right around the corner from the BART. Head to 2nd St and Market and you are literally minutes away from AT&T Park.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Carmenp
Reviews.Content: This was a great place, I could check in earlier than 3pm, and as I had requested a quiet room at the back of property I would not have thought I was downtown, it was so quiet. The staff were all fantastic, nothing was too much trouble and any questions were answered with a smile. The room had everything I needed, comfy bed and pillows,coffee maker, fridge and new flat screen tv. The bathroom had a bath/shower and the water was always hot,with lots of toiletries available. Hotel is close to Union Square, Ferry Plaza and most attractions,and Public transport is close by. Umbrellas are available to borrow too in case you strike a wet day!!! In the mornings coffee is available for guests and there is an afternoon wine reception as well. I had the best stay here and when I next visit San Francisco I won't hesitate in booking a room at The Galleria Park again. Thank you for a marvelous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Galleria Park!!”
Reviews.Author: TStroud
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in San Francisco 1/2 dozen times - and in a number of boutique hotels. Galleria Park is the roomiest hotel room I've stayed in SF and one of the roomiest for a boutique hotel. I booked it through expedia - and received a great package deal. They were so friendly with my requests- I really appreciated how nice everyone was even though I booked through a 3rd party website. This is so close to everything- Union Square, SFMOMA,Chinatown. This is my new hotel to stay in while in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “An elegant boutique hotel at the heart of Union Square!”
Reviews.Author: nave_cv
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in the heart of Union Square, close to many touristy bits of the town. The best part of this hotel is the service, the concierges and the front desk staff were extremely helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel also gives you complimentary walking tour with Rick Evans - I highly recommend this to any tourist whether staying in this hotel or not. Very informative 2 hour walk starting from Galleria Park Hotel's lobby. The only downside to this hotel was the room size. The queen room should ideally be given out only as a single room with a single bed - definitely too small for two people. Having said that, from what I have heard this is a typical problem with hotels in San Francisco. So I guess one will have to compromise a bit. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel near great shopping and good food.”
Reviews.Author: shellymarina
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! It has everything - great customer service (especially Zach), clean rooms, valet parking and a free evening wine reception. The location is ideal for visitors - there are great restaurants (try Trademark for gourmet American pub fare) and fantastic shopping (Union Square is right around the corner.) The staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. We were in town on a busy weekend (Bay to Breakers) but were still able to get personalized attention and have all of our needs met.

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain on Union Square”
Reviews.Author: wilinili
Reviews.Content: This place is a great deal any way you slice it - price, location, friendly staff, comfortable bed, wine reception. I've stayed in a lot of hotels in SF and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Even though it's given less than 4 stars based on whatever scale they use for that sort of thing, I would give it 4 stars. You won't find a similar hotel in downtown SF at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Backward technology lets it down”
Reviews.Author: Kenny353
Reviews.Content: Free wifi - excellent. Not being able to log onto wifi with both phone and laptop simultaneously - 2003 called, their wifi is missing. Deliberately throttling wifi speed in a pathetic attempt to extort extra fees from guests - go get your Hilton franchise already. Sort it out. This is San Francisco. You should be leading the nation on this. It's trivial to change the wifi configuration to allow e.g. five devices per room number and surname instead of just one. And throttling is just mean. Aside from that, this is an excellent hotel. I stayed here when it was a Kimpton hotel, it's better than that now. The two rooms I've seen are much bigger than the shoebox I had before - each time was name-your-own-price, so presumably they're not run-of-housing it. Service is superb, free wine at 6pm and free morning coffee. So, despite wifi ridiculousness, recommended. Especially given it was as-good-as-free on priceline ;)

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied at first, but later found out I got charged an extra $94.”
Reviews.Author: dsong90
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was pretty nice. The people at the front desk were friendly and made me feel comfortable. I was asked if I was 21 years of age upon checking in and since I was not they removed all the alcoholic beverages from the honor bar in our room. The room was nicely decorated, although a bit cramped. You can only open the bathroom door halfway because the door is in the corner of the room and they decided to place a chair and ottoman in that same corner. Also, the TV did not turn on with both the remote and manually. Someone had to come reset the TV for us which took nearly 15 minutes for him to do so. Overall, I would not pay $200 to stay here for just one night. Very nice people and good service, but not worth the money. I left satisfied until a few days later I noticed $94 in various charges on my credit card bill. I called the hotel and explained that the alcoholic beverages were taken out upon my arrival, so it was adjusted to $55. I asked why I was even charged for the $55 and she did not even know and told me I would have to wait for the front desk to reach me within the next 24 hours. Now I am definitely never returning to this hotel. Its just not worth all the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Bob/Paula
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here with another couple. We really had a fine experience. Room was modest but ample size, everything clean. The service really stood out - the rotating desk staff performed concierge-type services: recommendations, directions, reservations, storing our bags while we explored. The location is an easy walk to the BART and to downtown sights and restaurants. The value was also exceptional - a regular weekend rate of $139 and a special promotion - your second night's rate is your birth year (a major bargain in my case). Two points to consider - courtyard rooms are very quiet, streetside rooms a little less so, although our friends said it was not bad. Also it was disappointing that the computers on site were not free, though wi-fi is.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location.”
Reviews.Author: butlerdidit2
Reviews.Content: Cute older style hotel, rooms were more than adequate for travellers. Nice outdoor area for a bit of peace and quiet at the end of the day. The entrance has a couple of steps the get up to the reception area, which is a pain if you've got a few bags and they're heavy (as ours were) Location was great, only a couple of blocks from the main tram / trolley lines down to fisherman's wharf and also close to Union square.

Reviews.Title: “Galleria Park is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: rdimarco
Reviews.Content: The Galleria Park Hotel in San Francisco is an excellent hotel right minutes away from Union Square. The Hotel staff is extremely approachable, friendly, accommodating, knowledgeable and helpful. Every hotel employee went beyond their way to make sure that our stay there was a happy and comfortable one. They have a complimentary wine hour every day between 5:30 and 6:30 in the lobby area which allows fellow hotel guests to come together in order to relax and mingle while enjoying some wine. This is very appreciated by everyone! The hotel offers free wi-fi access and the rooms are nicely decorated and clean. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning to stay in San Francisco. I will definitely be returning soon! I would like to express a HUGE thank you to everyone at Galleria Park for ensuring that our stay there was an impeccable one!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: RedDogLeader
Reviews.Content: Our Spring Break trip San Francisco was amazing and a big part of that was due to our fabulous hotel. The Galleria Park Hotel was perfect! The location is right next to Union Square which is shopping central of the city. Also, the hotel is near several public bus, cable car, and street car stops. The Galleria Park is a charming older building that has fully modern guest rooms. The bathrooms are quite small, but other than that we found the rooms to be comfortable and relaxing. The beds were very comfortable. The only draw-back was the street noise during the night. However, I'm used to the silence of the country so the noises at night seemed quite loud to me. If that kind of thing bothers you, ask to be moved to an interior courtyard room. Both the day-time and night-time staff were warm and welcoming. At the end of the day when we arrived back at the hotel, exhausted from our walking and sight-seeing, we felt that the Galleria Park was our home away from home. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visitng San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean, extremely friendly staff and plenty of style”
Reviews.Author: wildhorsleys
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly located near Union Square, yet just set back enough to enable a quiet night's sleep every night. The lobby is spectacular, the room was really comfortable and clean, and staff were possibly the nicest I've encountered. You get free in-room wi-fi (or free 20mins if you use hotel computers) and free use of a nice roof terrace. Also, it's close to Market Street, meaning you can easily get the trolley bus ($2) to Fisherman's Wharf, as well as the more scenic (and more expensive) cable cars. Lots of shops nearby, including a 7-11 and Walgreen's.

Reviews.Title: “Location and customer service are top notch.”
Reviews.Author: comicrph
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly. They recommended places to eat (which very few are open for breakfast). The hotel is very close to many restaurants and the close proximity to Union Square, Mascone Center and public transportation make it very easy to get around the city. Free morning coffee and newspaper as well as the evening wine is a great touch. Now they also have a new sushi restaurant that opened next door which we didn't get a chance to try, but looked like a great place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Great staff”
Reviews.Author: DBSTexas
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Galleria Park and it was even better than the first one!! The hotel is very clean and all of the staff is incredibly friendly. They were able to give us directions anywhere we wanted to go as well as directing us to the correct public transportation. When we arrived I mentioned it was our anniversary and when we got back to our room later in the day there was a bottle of champagne on ice for us. What a nice, surprising touch!! This time I requested a room away from the street. The view wasn't much but it was extremely quiet and that was what we wanted. The wine reception is also a nice touch. People are very friendly and we had several interesting conversations with fellow travelers. The location is great with easy walking to Chinatown, the Embaradero and Union Square. I am a Travel Agent and will certainly recommend this hotel to my clients!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel in the Heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: wedding_2010_disney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to San Francisco on business, and we found the Galleria Park Hotel to have exceeded our expectations. The hotel itself is very trendy yet professional and business-minded. The only reason I gave the "Rooms" category 4/5 stars is because it was moderately sized (not spacious, not small); it had a more urban loft-like feel. What stands out the most was their service--the Front Desk was very friendly and accommodating with anything that we needed. They had some very good specials going (which can be seen on their website). The special we took advantage of was free parking, which is a real plus in the city. Their location makes them walking distance to just about all the attractions in the city. Plus, there is a complimentary Architecture Tour. We travel a lot and have stayed at many top-name hotels, and we would definitely prefer to stay here again as our top choice for San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic customer service!”
Reviews.Author: snadypooh
Reviews.Content: Loved the earth friendly aspects of the hotel. It was the first hotel with a recycling bin and biodegradable bottles of shampoo/conditioner. The complimentary coffee was an excellent start to the morning. Zach at the front desk welcomed our group and even provided us with 2 bottles of complimentary wine. He really set the tone for a great stay at the hotel. For all the people that love big hotel rooms and bathrooms, this would not be the hotel for you. The rooms are quite small and the bathrooms all have pedestal sinks. The only bright enough light to do makeup was in the bathroom but there was nowhere to put your makeup. It was hard with all girls since we each needed a mirror and lights! Overall, a good stay I did let the hotel know they need better and more lighting. Valet parking was $35/day but you got in and out access throughout the day. Lots of great food and shopping in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: khmetalworkdotcom
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, great staff. Good coffee in the morning and wine in the evening, super clean room, linens and towels above the usual, good internet speed - no hesitation to recommend this property. We parked our car at check in and didn't get back into it until we left - walk to Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square, any type of restaurant you could want & world class shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay in an absolutely perfect location at an excellent price!”
Reviews.Author: KDurhamjr
Reviews.Content: This was a return trip to the Galleria Park for me. Every member of the hotel staff did their part to ensure that my stay was exactly what I needed it to be, from directions to dining and entertainment recommendations to service with valet park, having the car ready for me when I needed it. The location was great for me with 24 Hour Fitness at the end of the block and two blocks from Union Square and Chinatown it was easy to walk almost anywhere. The Paul Frank store down the block had a few great gifts for my kids and if shopping had been the reason for my visit there seemed to be a store for every occasion. The night life within 1-6 blocks of the hotel was a great way for my colleagues and me to unwind at the end of the day. For those that want to use cabs, we did a few times and paid $5-$8 to get to or from almost anywhere in the downtown SF area. When I checked out, I expected to pay $48 per night for the two nights of my stay for parking, but because I registered through the hotel and not a third part, the parking was included in my stay. My Colleagues went through a third part and had to pay to park. Overall, an excellent experience and one that will ensure that every time I travel to the area, I will stay at the Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with this place, will definetly be coming back. Thanks Grant and Zack!”
Reviews.Author: BrazilianBabe493
Reviews.Content: I came for a weekend getaway with my boyfriend and we had an amzing time! This hotel was walking distance to almost anything and even if it was a cab drive the most I paid was $10 including tip! The area felt totally safe, no matter what time it was. The service here was excellent everyone was super friendly. Zack and Grant are AWESOME, make sure to give them a hello because I have no doubt in my mind they will take the best care of you as they did for us :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tellalltraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel efficiently allocates resources to those elements most important to guests: modern style rooms and lobby, modern bathrooms, great beds, kind service. While the fitness center and halls could be updated, and while the in-room televisions are not flat screens, altogether I was very pleased with my stay at Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing since I love the Joie de Vivre Hotels normally”
Reviews.Author: Lagreenwell
Reviews.Content: The fact that they say they have a fitness center is a joke. It's a couple machines in a cramped stinky room that was not built to be a gym (not ventilated correctly), which whatever, that's common. What made me mad was the hours-7am-9pm. Those are working hours! This hotel is near the financial district, how silly to assume we aren't up before that, and after that. Everyone broke the rules, but even if you'd sneak down at 6am, the gym was already packed because it is too small for the amount of rooms. The room was also cramped, not set up the most logically with walkways tight to cross the room. The bathroom had no space to put hairspray, face wash, etc up. I understand small space, but it just wasn't set up with usable shelves or anything, poor design and planning, just not a very feng shui area, I did not feel relaxed squeezing through and storing my stuff on the floor for a week. My co-worker told me her street facing room was horribly loud and she didn't sleep all week. The staff was gracious, wine hour was nice as always, but their facilities could use a good revamp, it just wasn't logical.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location When Visiting SF!”
Reviews.Author: EastBayMom42
Reviews.Content: Ok, I'm not really from way too far, in fact I live in the East Bay of the SF Bay Area. But being from the suburbs, my family and I sometimes like to play tourists in the city. When my young son had to do a report on the Chinese New Year for school, we decided to make a weekend getaway of it and spend a night in the city to watch the Chinese New Year parade. We checked in at the Galleria Park Hotel and was amazed with the location, the chic lobby and the friendly front desk staff. But let's go back to the location. Upon stepping out, you step into shopping paradise. You can feel the spirit of SF surround you. In addition to that, the charming Ferry building, Chinatown, Union Square and the cable cars are all within reach. When we got to the room, we loved the corner suite which was perfect for us and our three young children. More importantly, we didn't have to view the parade in the rain on the bleachers like many. We had a wonderful view from our 3rd floor suite cornering Sutter and Kearny -all warm, comfy and happy. My son was tickled pink to have a great view of the parade as we, his parents took photos of the parade for our personal collection as well as for his report. All in all, we were all very pleased with our stay. The location, the friendliness and the comfy accommodations made Galleria Park Hotel a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: charleneshouse
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! It was really comfy, stylish & in a great neighborhood for exploring San Francisco! p.s. I want to buy their pillows!!!

Reviews.Title: “we loved your hotel..can't wait till we go back..the best pet friendly hotel..thank you!”
Reviews.Author: nghepler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best pet friendly hotel I've ever stayed in.Your hotel is my new favorite place in SFO!..your whole entire staff was so friendly.We're eager to return to your wonderful city!..again thank you for making our stay so pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “We could live here”
Reviews.Author: pokeycip
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It's beautifully decorated. I wish their decorator could do my house. The staff is always gracious. The location is close to so much in San Francisco and very close to Union Square, but because it's a little closer to the Financial District it's a little less touristy. It's a great value for the area. They have a fireplace in the foyer where they serve wine in the evenings, and they have a garden area with a walking track. I gave it a 4 for sleep quality because there was a bit of street noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “A great hidden treasure!”
Reviews.Author: NTinAZ
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to be introduced to Galleria Park through a friend that had stayed at the hotel prior to us making our travel plans. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. They knew the area restaurants and made great suggestions, which was tough as we were there for the Thanksgiving holiday and most places had different hours than normal. The room was very nice, clean, a little small, but had great character! We had the pleasure of meeting several fellow travelers in the lobby for the hour of wine, and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The location is perfect - just off Union Square and only a few blocks from BART. It couldn't be more centrally located. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with personal service.”
Reviews.Author: mstevens616
Reviews.Content: When traveling in large cities, I tend to find the large conference (chain) hotels even at the conference rate are well over $200-$250/night so I look for smaller, boutique hotels that are less expensive. I found this hotel through kayak.com and was happy with the results. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Although I only was able to enjoy it once, the evening wine reception was a nice touch. I appreciate the free wireless internet (which is often $15/day in larger hotels). It was close to shopping and to the Embarcerdero Center where my meetings were. The only downside to this site was one night I was awoken by what sounded like a garabage truck and some construction at 3 in the morning, but I know that this was beyond the control of the hotel and is something that I could have encountered at any hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Up All Night”
Reviews.Author: audraandiris
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel that has been nicely re-appointed, however, it's age shows through. The decor looks decent, but the paint was peeling off in my room. There was a poorly-insulated window-unit air conditioner in the room which made for a noisy night. It sounded like I was sleeping (trying to sleep) right on the street. The beds are small. I'm 5'5" and my feet hung off the end just a tad. The beds are also super springy and gave me a terrible backache. The staff was courteous. I was charged $1 for "Asian Women's Resource Center - Donation." What? No one asked me to make any donation. I call that stealing. The credit card machine conveniently did not work when I was checking out (perhaps part of the donation scheme?). Don't go past the lobby...

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: renatoma
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, courteous & pleasant employees, clean & quite rooms. They also serve free wine late afternoon. We surely will go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ginabcarr
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in SF that is classy, clean, fun and in a great location then Galleria Park Hotel is the best there is. The staff was friendly, funny and always willing to help, the room was beautiful and clean,free wifi, cable, wine bar in the evening, the location is absolutely perfect (Right off Union Sq, surrounded by all the best shops, some great resturants and only a few blocks from the China Town gates), great prices for the quality and you can bring your dog! There is a roof top garden area to exercise/relieve your pet, smoke if you need or just have fun watching the street below. Really a great experience staying at this hotel, after years of trying out different hotels in SF, we will never stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for city sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: mattnerja
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff who could not do enough to satisfy your stay in the Galleria Park Hotel. Not a pretty view from our inside room but we only iused the room for sleeping and preferred the inner side to avoid street noise. Nice to have a shower robe to use. Loved the complimentary wine hour each evening. Very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice and Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetBlue777
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, the location was close to Chinatown, shops, restaurants and other attractions. The staff - they were okay, a bit classy and not very cheery or friendly, but still good. The rooms were excellent, it was unique in its own way - the bathroom was well stocked and the hotel itself has this really cozy feel. The fireplace was an added bonus, we stayed at the lobby for some times because our flight arrived at 7AM, but they checked us in early instead of 3PM. Overall, a nice hotel with a good price. Stayed their for two nights . The hotel was cozy, trendy and modern, would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jdog16
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel. The staff were super friendly and very helpful. We received a complimentary upgrade to a king room and the bed was so comfortable. The hotel was in a good location- found it to be quiet and out of the way however was still in walking distance to shopping and restaurants. The business centre offers free internet (you get 20 minutes every 24 hours) which was handy because I didn't have my own laptop. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel ... excellent service...great location...”
Reviews.Author: 3beezmum
Reviews.Content: I really love the attention to detail that Joie de Vivre puts into their properties. So far, all the JDV hotels we've stayed at (5 now) never fail to impress both in facility and staff. The hotel had a very modern and classy feel. I was pleasantly surprised to walk into the room with a high ceiling that offered an open and airy feel to the room. Most older hotels have lower ceilings which may feel a bit claustrophobic. The king size bed and pillows were clean and comfortable and the honor bar and refrigerator were fully stocked. I am particular about the cleanliness of the bathroom and was satisfied that it was clean and odor free so even if it was not a full size bathroom, I did not mind the size at all. The staff was very accommodating and welcoming. We were especially impressed with the doorman and valet staff with who always gave perfect instructions to navigate around the area. One concern sacrificed a star on sleep quality and that was due to street noise that night. It could have been a fluke incident that particular night, but I woke up to the sound of someone in the street yelling at someone for a couple of minutes. I'm a light sleeper so I noticed it however, my hubby slept through it all. Despite the brief interruption, I easily caught up with more Zzzs and woke up well rested . I wouldn't make much of it as on goings outside the hotel's property would really be out of their control. Shopping convenience was a plus. The shopping is literally a stone's throw away. It was a good thing my shoes were not too comfortable otherwise my hubby would've been dragged around with a handful of shopping bags. Next to the hotel is an outdoor mall called the Crocker Galleria with shops and cafes to cater to your shopping and caffeine fix. It's proximity to the restaurant where we had dinner was perfect for an easy stroll. Dinner at Oola on Folsom was sumptuous and is definitely a must for late diners. Kitchen serves food 'til 12am! My hubby and I had a very relaxing and carefree stay at Galleria Park Hotel. We are both looking forward to our next JDV getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful hosts, lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: delanor
Reviews.Content: We wish everyone ran a hotel this well! Very friendly, helpful staff, comfortable lobby with complementary wine in the evening and a fireplace; delicious free coffee in the AM. We stayed for 3 nights then left to stay with friends for a few days, but when the east coast got snowed under, we ended up having to stay in SF for 4 more days (big problem eh?) and liked this place so much we came right back. When we checked back in, the valet remembered us and sent up cocoa and biscotti to our room as a hello. Wow. Walking distance to great restaurants, transportation, easy valet parking. Rooms were smallish but bed was quite comfy, free wifi, a staff that genuinely wants you to enjoy your stay. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, basic hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: rmox
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip, and was kept so busy with meetings that I didn't take full advantage of the fun extras associated with this hotel - namely the complementary wine hour each evening, or the rooftop terrace/sitting area. However, the hotel was very comfortable and was decorated beautifully. You can tell that it is an old building, but all amenities are modern. Quite frankly, the glimpes of age within the building are charming. Small room but pretty and comfortable. Friendly staff. Hotel is in an excellent location for both business and pleasure and is a nice change from the more sterile, large hotel chains like Hyatt/Hilton/Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “central, friendly, clean - in short: VERY recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: fedtmule99
Reviews.Content: Spending Xmas with friends in Berkeley on the other side of the East Bay, but having decided against having to sleep on a couch because the house was so full of visitors, I chose this small hotel because of the central location, only one block from Montgomery St. BART and previous ratings, and I must say, I was not disappointed at all. Staff was very friendly, room was not large, but clean and cleaned daily. I had called inadvanced and asked for a roon away from the street, a whish that was granted immediately. I never used their daily offer of wine tasting but frequently upon returning from somewhere saw loads of people sitting around the cozy reception area with wine glasses. My overall impression is a very nice and friendly, albeit small hotel, centrally located - will surely use again !

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if sleep is not what you need and location convenience is”
Reviews.Author: cmarsha2
Reviews.Content: Reserved with Priceline and called ahead 2 weeks in advance to ensure I secured a room with 2 beds. Arrived to be told they had a King and could add a sleeper - sleeper would not fit -- took my husband to push the issue to force a switch to room with two beds. No flat screens here. No heat either unless you like a radiator that does not work -who wants a repairmen in your room as you're ready for bed! The windows leak - no sound resistance and guarantee to be awakened by trash trucks at 10pm, 2 am, and 5am. No space in bathroom for any of your stuff. and to top it off, no one mentioned they charge $35 a day for our car to be parked until you check out. They charge as much as public parking so where is the amenity with that? Try someplace else if you want a good night sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Promised much, delivered very little”
Reviews.Author: mountainwineryfan
Reviews.Content: We had a pre-paid Priceline reservation. When we arrived, we were told the hotel was all booked. We were to be sent to a "sister hotel" two miles away for one night. I responded that we didn't wish to be moved after one night. I was told the hotel would only pay for one night at the other hotel. I threw a tantrum & they agreed to pay for two nights. I know screw-ups can happen, but this one was handled badly by staff. Very unpleasant experience, & we were stuck a couple of miles from downtown. The second hotel (Hotel Tomo) was pleasant enough, but definitely not the downtown location we sought. On the second evening, I got a call from the Galleria Park manager apologizing. She then spontaneously offered to return our Priceline payment. That would have made me feel better, if it had happened -- but three weeks later I am still waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in all of San Francisco!!!”
Reviews.Author: dbottjer32706
Reviews.Content: The Galleria Park is truly one of the best hotels in San Francisco! The location is perfecct. Once they park our car, we don't have to see it again until we leave. The hotel is conveniently located between the financial district and Union Square so you can walk everywhere! We've even walked to the Ferry Building - a mere 15 minute walk away. You will find the staff welcoming and extremely knowledgeable about the restaurants and other SF sites. We absolutely love this hotel! The rooms are beautifully appointed and the 5:30 p.m. wine hour is very, very nice! We have met some wonderful people while sipping on good CA white wine. You won't be disappointed if you book a room at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: mozgal
Reviews.Content: We called the Galleria Park Hotel home this past weekend for my birthday -- what a joy! The hotel decor/ambiance is lovely, and our room was charming and much bigger than expected. Also, when the hotel staff learned it was my birthday, they sent wine/tulips/chocolates up to my room to celebrate -- what a touch of class! We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A customer is a customer is a customer.... Right?!”
Reviews.Author: Karikarate
Reviews.Content: We booked off of priceline so our choices to stay out here were limited but we were excited to find out that we would be staying at the Galleria. We stayed here a few years ago while they were under construction so we were looking forward to seeing what has been done to the hotel. We are members if the Joy of Life club by Joie de vivre because we stay often in joie de vivre hotels. The rooms here are small and outdated ... On the website it boasted flat screen tvs ... We have a very old TV .. The worst part of this stay (because I am writing this while sitting in the room) is when I called to ask for a larger bed ... The front desk told me because I booked with priceline this is all they had. I feel like a second class customer here. Shouldn't all customers be treated equal? No matter what company they booked with?

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: harinreddy
Reviews.Content: Me and my senor collegue from India stayed here and participated in AIChE symposium in the city. Room service was prompt and good. Morning coffee and evening wine festival were fine . Hope it is decent hotel for a short stay and economical . Room was nice and compact enough for twin sharing.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale, cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: podunk_poppers
Reviews.Content: The Galleria Park was surpringly perfect for a recent getaway to SF. The rooms are on the small side, but that seems standard in SF. I loved the decor, and although the rooms seemed a tad worn, everything was clean and comfy. We were on the 2nd floor, street side, and weren't bothered by any street noise. I would recommend this hotel to anyone... we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tancred32
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The room was nice & clean and the location was good - not right in the heart of it all but only a short walk away from it. We found the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “location, great!”
Reviews.Author: rainbowribbon2002
Reviews.Content: you'd be hard up to find a location better than this. Just off market, accessible to buses and subway and bart. 3 blocks from china town and within walking distance of the procidio. rooms are alittle small, but staff was very accomodating, they served wine at 5:00 pm and answered any questions we had, not a large hotel, so individual attention is possible. Had a great time, I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again. For you coffee drinkers, star bucks on next block/7/11 as well.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be put off by the name”
Reviews.Author: Bridboy
Reviews.Content: Third stay in SF but first stay at this hotel. I was initially wary of the poncey name and its description as a "boutique" hotel owned by a group with the name "Joie de Vivre". It all sounded a bit camp. However, my granddaughter lives in SF and visited the hotel on an architectural tour and assured me it was fine. She was right. This hotel is very well located in the financial district. You can easily walk to the tourist parts of the city and the BART railway system is very close by (handy to know when you are dragging your bags to and from the airport). The room I had on the seventh floor was spacious and well equipped. The front desk staff were unfaillingly polite and helpful. The special factor of this hotel is the wine tasting every evening for an hour. Guests get together in the lobby and just enjoy some glasses of wine together. This creates a friendly atmosphere in which guesrs open up and share their experiences of the city. Better than a guide book! Also an excellent start to a good evening out. So dont be put off by the name. Just go for it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Fault it, Ideal Location to explore and feel safe, Adam (Burnley Lancs)”
Reviews.Author: Adam041971
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the galleria park, i was dubious prior as I did not know what to expect. However the price was reasonable, the hotel nice and clean and the rooms although not big, are very clean with nice decor. The location is the best though, altough there is a lot of walking to be done in SF the location of this place is superb, we really dont think we could have picked better. SF, although there are a few odd people around, there is no threatening atmosphere, i lovely place, my only regret is that we only had three days. ALCATRAZ IS A MUST THO!! book on line before you go to avoid disapointment

Reviews.Title: “A boutique place without the boutique worries”
Reviews.Author: DiscoBeavers
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on October 8th for one night while passing throught SF. Arrived at 8am and they checked us right in - which was a huge plus and a relief. I used hotwire for 2 adults, but hotwire put us in a room with a double bed "which frequently happens with hotwire" according to the staff. No worries as we were upgraded to king bed at no extra charge. Room was sized right for a boutique place - just what you would expect (odd angles, etc). Did the bed bug check and it passed. The place had free wine and we certainly got our moneys worth; made new friends from Virginia, Orange County, and Sacramento - thanks wine! Happy hour at the Midi lounge was great - trendy joint. Staff was very helpful with checkin, checkout, valet droppoff and retrieve. Would stay here again for sure. Paid $160 on a Friday night + tax + $35 for valet. Hotwire rate.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: cookiequeen35
Reviews.Content: This hotel met my needs when I was traveling for business. Wine in the lobby during happy hour time was a great welcoming touch. I di wish that the restaurant had been open on Sunday morning before I left to get a quick breakfast before having to travel all day. I had coffee but it would have been better if the restaurant had been open.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hokiecuz
Reviews.Content: the hotel location was great and the service at the front desk was excellent. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. The rooms are relatively small but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in centre of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Niki84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in September. Location is great, we were able to walk everywhere. We stayed in an inner courtyard room on the 7th floor, and it was super quiet. We heard no noise from outside or from other rooms. Hotel was very clean, with a comfy king size bed and a powerful shower. Staff were all really helpful, and the town car to the airport was great and not much more than a cab. Would stay here again if we travel back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for 5 nights to attend a...”
Reviews.Author: lovestotraveltoomuch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights to attend a conference. I enjoyed my stay last year so much that I didn't think twice about staying here again. The hotel is in a great location. It is a very short walk to Market Street and all of the shopping. The F line train stop was right across the street when you got onto market street. There was a bus stop around the corner of the hotel also. My room faced the interior so it was less noisy. Last year I had a room that faced out towards Sutter and it was noisy in the early morning. The room was neat and clean and I slept very well. I would recommend staying here if traveling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: justretired35
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to be helpful, and the free wine hour every afternoon gives guests an opportunity to meet fellow travelers. The rooms are clean and quiet. It's located in the financial district and therefore the area is pretty quiet on weekends and you have to travel a bit to get to museums but the buses are very convenient and it's also convenient to the BART to get to the airport (allow about an hour). Because of the location it's probably not the best place for children, but for an adult traveler who's willing to travel a bit it's a real winner!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible noise until 2AM from contruction across the street”
Reviews.Author: JoeinMB
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel and have conducted several business meetings here and personal stays over the years. I brought my wife here on one of our first dates over twenty years ago. So when we were able to get away for the weekend away from the now teenage kids I did not hesitate to make a reservation here. There was no mention of the on going construction across the street by the helpful reservations agent. When we checked in yesterday, again, no mention by the clerk and no letter from the manager about the loud construction site across the street (a mere 15 paces away.) We were assigned a room directly across from the construction site- it's mostly a major renovation. We had a lovely dinner at Scala's Bistro and revisited the lovely Starlight Room at the top of the Sir Francis Drake hotel. When we were walking back to the Galleria Park at 10PM we heard a lot of noise coming from the construction site. When we entered the hotel we asked the clerk if the noise was going to go on all night. No, we were assured. We watched a little TV and had to crank up the volume to mask the noise. Went to sleep at 10:30PM. Was awoken the first time at midnight by loud crashing- turned out to be huge chunks of concrete being tossed down metal chutes to a dump truck. Called the desk again. Yes, I was told, the noise is bothersome but it will end at midnight. It did not. Awoken again at 1:15AM. Oh, the clerk said, the permit allowed them to work until 3AM!!! but the manager had asked them to stop work at midnight. I was offered ear plugs. I left a voice mail for the manager which, I am sure, recorded the loud noises from across the street. A sleepness night capped by the constant drone of diesel truck parked across the street at 5AM with the engine running. I dressed and went to the lobby since I could not sleep. I asked the clerk to check on the truck and call the police to have it at least turn off its engine. He first said there was nothing he could do. At my further prompting he said he would check on it. He came back and promptly called the police. Based upon the lack of advance notice by reservations and no notification by the manager I would have to say that this borders on fraud and I would not recommend staying at the Galleria Park or any of the Joie de vivre properties. It was certainly not a professional way to treat guests and potential guests. There are lots of choices to stay in downtown San Francisco and I only wish I was afforded the opportunity to make a more informed choice. This was a rare beautiful clear and warm day in San Francisco! We are off to the Healdsburg for, hopefully, some well deserved R&R.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: StuAndCel
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff friendly, check in quick & easy, door staff always attentive. Room reasonable size, bigger than you would expect reading some of the reviews on here, plenty big enough for 2 people and 2 bags. A little bit dark, but this was due to it being an inner 'Courtyard' room. This meaning we didnt have any issues with street noise, we did however have the noisiest Air Conditioning Unit in the world, sounded like a bag of nails every time it started up! Location was great, close to Union Square, Market Street, Chinatown etc. Easy transport to airport or fishermans wharf nearby. Also got to say the Bread & Cocoa Coffee House next door is the best anywhere, amazing coffee!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: richie_63
Reviews.Content: family of 4 with 2 teenage girls stayed in august 2010 for 5 nights. hotel near Montgomery BART so easy to get to and from airport. one of the reasons we picked it. Near shopping area of union square. bit of a walk to north san fran pier 39 etc. room was quite small for a family of 4 with teenage girls. on floor 3 overlooking vermehr place. sleep was interrupted every night due to trash collection at 4 a.m. plus some vagrants looking through bins. room and hotel was very clean. free coffee every morning - which could be collected outside of first floor restaurant. didn't try food at hotel so can't comment however the restaurant looked very nice, good location for south of city - easy access to open top bus tour (to golden gate etc.) also easy for china town, shops. I would stay here again but would need a bigger room for 4.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, personal little hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Baazu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in two occasions on my trip to U.S. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who likes personal places over overcrowded big chains like Hilton etc. The rooms were small but very clean, and the housekeeping was excellent. Also the personell at the front desk were very helpful and polite. I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: ky776
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place to stay but the rooms are very small and somewhat cramped. I would recommend for business travelers and couples but not anyone with children. The staff is very nice and the rooms are kept clean. The location is centralized and a good jumping off point in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: marsriggs
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Nice location. Loved the evening wine hour. Our room was a bit small but it was on the interior so noise was not an issue. The bathroom paint was peeling a bit but again not a big deal. Although they have free in room wifi if you use the computer at the business center you pay for usage over 20 mins and everything you print. Rather cheesy for the vibe of hotel, especially since so many people need to check in for flights online and print boarding passes. Parking was valet only $35 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellerforpleasure
Reviews.Content: Recommended for a great location and every facility needed, close to Union Square with easting/coffeee places nearby. Helpful friendly staff and assistance with luggage was appreciated. Would not hesitate to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Crazyfool2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. I had never been to San Fransisco before so I just tried to find a good price hotel that wasn't too far from the Alcatraz ferry pier (which is about 30 mins walk if that) The receptionist was very friendly and made us feel welcome. Aparantly there was free wine late in the afternoon which sounded good but we were busy so didn't try that. The hotel was very nicely decorated like as if it had been done recently. Our bedroom was a queen size bed and it was on the 5th floor looking out onto sutter street. Even though it was a busy area it wasn't too loud for getting to sleep. The bathroom was a good size and the only critism is they could have done with having a light over the bath because it was a bit dark but still ok. We used the gym once and it only has a few machines in but enough for a decent work out. Our room had a good size tv, air con, mini bar, fridge, good size walk in closet, ironing board. Comfy bed and nice pillows. The only downside is if you have a car whilst you're visiting you have to use the valet parking which was about $35 per night but I compared it with others and it seemed the best deal. I booked this through expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best....”
Reviews.Author: MoopyMooMoo
Reviews.Content: I was quite excited about staying at this hotel as it looks fantastic on the website. The room was ok, small but clean, the bathroom however was mouldy with cracked tiles and my bed sheet and pillow had holes in it. I found the reception staff very short and rude and quite un helpful, we said we didnt want the $35 dollar a night valet parking although they tried to charge us for three nights worth on checkout. We also charged almost $70 dollars for a 5 minute call to LA (crazy) be warned. We were kept awake all night by a drilling putside our window, when asked about our stay we were just told 'everyone has complained about that' we also commented that our stay wasn't great but nothing was said. I f you want to feel welcome at a hotel don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever! Paid boutique prices for mid-level hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LA-DCguy
Reviews.Content: We have been very happy at Joie de Vivre hotels in SF and could not have been more dissapointed by this experience. We had trouble from the start--rude front desk staff, bellmen who never even attempted to help with baggage, problems with the bill and double charging our credit card, mishandled arrangments with the airport pick-up, and a very sub-standard room for a steep price (nearly $400/night). We ultimately got an upgrade since we were paying too much for such a small room (and are members of JdV), but the damage was done by the rude front desk service and general incompetence. A good thing: The housekeepers are nice. The hotel doesn't offer the services that a hotel charging these prices should have--for example, they have limited room service (none on weekend mornings), no concierge , terrible "gym", etc. Do yourself a favor and stay someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - excellent location and wine hour!”
Reviews.Author: L_traveller101
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on this hotel using expedia and were very very happy with our stay. We stayed for 3 nights on a tour around California. The location is excellent and the staff on front desk were very helpful at giving advice on where to eat/what to see. The room was very nice (if a bit small - only a very small criticism) and the wine hour is a nice touch. Would love to stop again for longer.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: coletteM1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the start of a 3 week holiday in California. The hotel is ideally situated close to both Union Square and Chinatown. We had two rooms and found them clean and extremely comfortable. We will be recommending this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in San Francisco for a few days. We went to the theatre (a good walk but taxis are cheap), Pier 39, Alcatraz, biked to Sausalito, ate in the Cheesecake Factory {top of Macy's and especially good for breakfast on the terrace overlooking the city) and did loads of sightseeing and shopping. This hotel suited our needs perfectly and was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and good location..”
Reviews.Author: Tene75
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel indeed.. good location about 10 minutes walk to Union Square. We had our room on the top floor so the room was quiet as well. We will definately come back to this hotel our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: ModernTraveler10
Reviews.Content: went to SF for 4th of July weekend. stay at the Galleria for 2 nights. great stay. well located property. smaller room but well designed, appointed and very comfortable. highly suggest it to someone that is looking for something nice, hip and cool but still very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to start a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: rjmccurdy1011
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to San Francisco so I didn't know what was in store for us. It was the kickoff stay to our elopement and honeymoon and we wanted something centrally located in the city for our first three days so we could really experience the city. The location was perfect for what we wanted. We could walk to Chinatown and Union Square and was only a couple of blocks from Market street and the cable car lines. It was also a short cab ride to the restaurants in North Beach and city hall where we had to get our marriage license. With two of our three days spent over the weekend, the Financial District was a good place to land because it was relatively quiet and cheap. The rates went up on Monday when business picked up around the hotel. The hotel is old, but renovated well with all the modern conveniences. We loved the lobby and the way it was decorated, plus enjoyed the complimentary wine tasting in the evening. We got upgraded to a suite which was a nice touch from the staff. The bathroom was small, but the TV room was nice because it was separate from the bedroom. The bedroom also had a TV, and the bed was certainly roomy and comfortable if a tad firm. The restaurant which was part of the hotel featured a really good breakfast. I recommend the french toast. The staff was super friendly and helpful especially since we were tourists with no real San Fran experience. They pointed us in the right direction each time and no question was too silly. If there was one complaint, it was that the rooms could get pretty noisy with the street traffic, so if you're a light sleeper, it could be a bit of a problem. I did all right and I can sometimes sleep lightly in new places, but it was noticeable. If we go back, we wouldn't hesitate staying here or one of the other many properties the owners have around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Kazza78
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful throughout our stay. Our King size room was a decent size and more importantly - very comfy bed. We faced Sutter St and it could be a bit noisy. But nothing more than you would expect with a City centre hotel, it never bothered us. We never went down for the free wine (mainly because I don't like wine). But it seem very popular with other guests & the lobby with fire is really nice. Would recommend this hotel - but took us a while to find restaurants nearby we liked. Everything in financial district closes at night or is very touristy at Union Sq. Breakfast/lunch - next door is a coffee shop that can be a bit pricey but very nice. On the next block up on Sutter St - Posh Bagel shop is really good and a bargain. Good for lunch and breakfast - close enough to bring back to the hotel for breakfast in bed if you want. A few blocks up still on Sutter St - Lori's Diner for typical American breakfasts. Evening - Lori's diner is good for burgers & fries etc. China town is an easy walk away. After China Town is North Beach for so many lovely Italian restaurants you will have a hard time choosing - 15/20 min easy walk (pretty flat). When you get there just go along Columbus Ave. If you don't want to walk get the 8X bus just round the corner from hotel (outside the coffee shop which is next to hotel on Kearney St). Goes through China Town, Noth Beach and down to Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gersa
Reviews.Content: We arrived early after a 12 hour flight and was greeted with a smile and able to check in early. The room as we expected from other reviews small but very clean and what I thought was a large bathroom by New Zealand standards. This hotel is close to everything you need with the Bart & Streetcar just around the corner on Montgomery Street. The Free Wine Hour in the lobby is a great way to meet other guests. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LOVENATLPARKS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night at the Galleria Park in early June when we attended the Impressionist exhibition at the DeYoung Museum. Our room was very pleasant; I'd say that the hotel is one of the finer boutique hotels in which I have stayed near Union Square. The hotel was quite convenient to the Ferry Building where the AMTRAK bus brought us and later met us for our ride to the Emerville train station. The lack of Sunday room service is a disappointment as was the Midi restaurant's brunch. I would suggest other eating establishments for breakfast/brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Travellingirl58
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and found it to be very clean and tidy and the bed and pillows were excellent. I find these the most important things when staying at any hotel. Staff were fine, I would say professional and polite. Didn't really speak to anyone other than at check in and check out. Enjoyed the complimentary tea and coffee each morning and wine each evening. The seats by the fire in the reception area were very cosy and welcoming as it was chilly some days. Free use of the internet for 20 minutes each day was also very beneficial. The location is excellent, near to shopping, F line, buses and the Bay area.Rather noisy area at night but it is a city after all, and we were there over the weekend when people were out late making merry. We found this hotel good value and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reeves68
Reviews.Content: After a couple of weeks on tour staying in mainly, not unpleasant, but very samey motel style accommodation we found this boutique style hotel excellent. Great location for shopping and sightseeing. Loved the rooftop garden/walking area. Very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “was ok if you don't stay in your room”
Reviews.Author: MelissaEPower
Reviews.Content: For the price and location, its a pretty good deal. We had # 415 and the A/c was not working, so we got switched to #215. Its a pretty noisy part of town. All night I heard the metal from the trolley rail. Every time a car drove over the railing, it was obnoxious. The only thing offered is coffeetea in the morning for free and that was alright. Theres no pool or jacuzzi and the rooms were ok. Nothing great. I'm sure for the price, you can find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: rubbiecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family event for about 40 people. Terrific location, staff was professional and accomodating. This is a smallish boutique hotel with full service - room service, valet parking, meeting rooms, bar & restaurant. Rooms were small but efficiently organized and well appointed. Our event was held in one of the conference rooms but it was set up beautifully for our needs. Buffet meal and servers were good. It made for a lovely event and for good memories. Parking fee is stiff - $35 for cars and $40 or more for oversized SUV's. Only small problem now is getting a copy of my bill for review. The printer was working slowly upon checkout and we had to leave without it. I've sent emails for 3 days now trying to get a copy. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, good experience!”
Reviews.Author: mnstn
Reviews.Content: First of all, Expedia gave us a wonderful deal for 5 nights at the hotel and round trip with United (IAD-SFO), so we had a great feeling about the whole trip to begin with. Being from the East Coast, this was our first stay at Joie de Vivre Hotel chain and overall we had a really good experience. The hotel has absolutely fantastic location: Walking distance to many attractions, bars, restaurants, shops, MUNI and Bart stops. The staff was really courteous and helpful about anything and everything. Our flight arrived in the morning and we were in our room freshening up 15 minutes after we walked into the hotel, we were definitely very thankful. We checked out their restaurant Midi for dinner (room service) and Sunday brunch. In both cases the food was good, the service was very prompt and staff was friendly. The room was a little too small for comfort and there was not much natural light coming in as we were facing one of the towers, but it was OK, especially since we did not spend too much time in the room (and the rooms overlooking the street can get really noisy). I really enjoyed their bathroom products. The hotel had free wireless internet, which is a rarity, however be aware that it can be slow to download attachments etc. and the strength of the connection can be very weak from time to time. Overall, our experience was really great and we will definitely look for the hotel chain when we are back in the region. Recommend for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Great Service, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: mike53226
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Galleria Park Hotel, my 1st trip to San Francisco. The hotel is fine, perfect location, nice service and incredible value. It is a small botique hotel, no gym or pool, 1 restaurant and bar. We booked a standard room w/ a queen bed. Although the room was small (14 x 14), it was modern, clean, cozy and comfortable. The room came with a working safe, free wireless, shower (no tub) and single sink. They offer an upgrade to a larger room or suite for $40 but we declined as we knew we'd hardly be there except at night. What makes Galleria Park great is the location! 2 block from high end shopping, 2 blocks from Chinatown, 5 blocks to North Beach (Italian District) and a 20 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Everything is nearly walkable! Bring comfortable shoes and dress in layers, you'll want to peel off as it gets warm in the pm. We almost booked at near the Wharf but glad we did not because much too touristy there and the restaurants and nightlife are much better in North Beach which is closer to the hotel. I highly recommend staying at Galleria Park, we will definitely return. If this is your 1st trip to San Francisco, I'd recommend the following: Take a ferry around the Bay and/or spend an pm in Sausalito. Have dinner at the Stinking Rose, Calzone or the Fog City Dinner, fantastic food and reasonable prices but book ahead at opentable.com Have dim sum in Chinatown. Have drinks at Cafe Vesuvio. Eat Gellato in North Beach. Have lunch in Chinatown, I recommend the Broadway Cafe for authentic Chinese food at very cheap prices. Have pizza in North Beach, I highly recommend Tony's Pizza! Have breakfast at Mama's. Watch people doing Tai Chi on a Sat. am in Washington Park. Tour Alcatraz. See City Lights Bookstore, where the Beat Generation began. Have Sunday Brunch at the Sheraton Palace, an amazing and historic place. Eat fresh seafood at Fisherman's Wharf. Walk down Lombard Street and see the crooked block. Ride a Trolley. See the sea lions at the Wharf. Take a cab to the Golden Gate entrance and walk in the adjacent park. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: sueyVictoria
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. They let us lock our bike in the secure underground parking garage. Sutter Street gave us a great flat home base to begin our bicycle rides. Close enough to walk to SOMA, North Beach, Waterfront, Chinatown, big shopping stores. Next door was a coffee shop with great espresso and oatmeal breakfast. Across the street, was inexpensive juice bar. The lobby was relaxed and played electro lounge music. Free wine hour every night. Mainly younger clientele. Mellow , easy going place.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but shame about the corrupt doormen”
Reviews.Author: TrxterW11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine. I stayed for 6 nights, and while the "Deluxe King" room was small (edge around the bed end), it ticked all the boxes for a business class hotel - clean, friendly staff, free wifi etc. I was surprised they don't serve breakfast at weekends, which was annoying but did send me off to Dottie's for a brilliant pancake or three. I'd give the hotel restaurant a miss. That was one dry, bog standard burger. The bizarre thing about this hotel (and many other SF ones apparently) is the fact that the doormen operate a con. Ask them to order you a taxi, and they call their favourite cab company. When the cabbie arrives, he asks you whether it's cash or credit card. If you say the former, the cabbie has to pay the doorman $10 and if it's CC, they pay $5. I saw the "transaction" - the cabbie passed the bill to the doorman who palmed it. Now that HAS to be illegal. I asked him why he paid the doorman and he said that if he didn't pay, he would not get the call from the switchboard putting him on the fare. He said that the doormen have an agreement to share what they take from the cabbies with the cab company switchboard operator. My cabbie told me that this is the way it works in San Francisco. If you complain, you get no fares. And no-one will snitch for obvious reasons. RICO... So, a standard hotel if you can ignore the corruption on the door.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up for Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieR
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights recently. Best thing was the comfortable bed! We had an inside (away from street) room which was very quiet at night. Place is well decorated, but here and there in our room was some chipped paint, but is expected for an older building. All amenities we needed were here, so would recommend. Only 2 blocks from BART, easy 30 minute ride to SFO.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: CamperE
Reviews.Content: We had a great Valentine's stay at the Galleria Park. We stayed in a very nice suite. The Decor was modern but timeless...the location is great, close to everything! But the real "hidden treasure" of this hotel is the restaurant! Midi is great and available as room service as well. Staff is really nice without any of the attitude I encounter in nicer or "design" hotels. Very genuine and honest. Wine hour is a great idea too!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but small, with good design”
Reviews.Author: TeamRandR
Reviews.Content: So far this is our favorite Joie de Vivre in the Union Square / Financial district. The lobby is very welcoming with comfy chairs and a fireplace. Ask for an exterior room unless you don’t mind looking into a smallish interior courtyard. Mr. R probably doesn’t care much about it, but I like pale blues and greens that break up the nice, bright white walls. A good paint job goes a long way, but cannot possibly mask the fact that this is a very old building. Beds are comfortable and the work area is sufficient although the internet was unreliable and unusably slow. Nothing notable in the bathroom, which given the age of the building is a good thing! Many restaurants are within a few blocks so we haven’t yet tried the hotel’s own eatery which is often too noisy for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SETHDEHART
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed at the Galleria before and I was very happy. I travel regularly for work and this was my first JDV Hotel experience. Everyone was very friendly and the rooms were clean. Unfortunately I didn't have a chance to check out the bar/restaurant, but they had teh Olympics on a screen and it looked like a lot of people were having fun. I would definitely stay this hotel and my only complaint is that I couldn't stay longer!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: stringman25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a 3 night stay at the Galleria Park. It is in a great location just 2 blocks above Union Square and 3 blocks from Powell St. Convenient to cable cars, restaurants, and shopping. The entrance to Chinatown was also a short 2 block walk. It is a smaller hotel, only a few stories. Rooms were very nice and decorated in a typical "boutique" style. Some people might think the rooms are small but we've stayed many places in San Francisco and thought they were similar in size. Rooms tend to be more European in size here. The staff was extremely friendly...everyone said hi when you walked through the lobby and the bellman opened the door each time in and out if he wasn't assisting another customer. They hold a complimentary wine reception in the lobby from 530p to 630p each night. We found it nice to have a couple glasses before we headed out for the evening. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair price”
Reviews.Author: bangorlad
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights here over Thanksgiving while visiting friends in Nob Hill. We spent one night at the Hotel des Arts around the corner but had to leave. Paid $90 a night for a great room in which we only slept. Modern decor, clean, everything worked, free Wi Fi, free coffee in the morning. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: CompulsiveReviewer
Reviews.Content: The plus points: + excellent location; really the best in San Francisco. Walking distance to China Town and Union Square and 2 mins walk from all public transport links. No car needed. + room decor is nice - contemporary. + complimentary wine 5:30-6:30pm daily. The negative points: - superficially the hotel is fine but you will soon be frustrated as nothing works (the heater doesn't work, the hairdryer cuts out every 2 mins, the remote control battery is flaky, the safe doesn't lock, the towels have holes in them) - the service at the front deks is poor - staff do not know the city well and frequently sent us to the wrong location. In summary, the location merits the price but you should look to pay no more than $90 per night to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!!”
Reviews.Author: fatebeliever
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what my husband and I were looking for on our first trip to San Fran! It is located two blocks from the center of union square, and china town, and with-in walking distance to little Italy! The staff was always friendly, internet access came in handy with our laptop, and Jacob, at the bell desk, was extremely helpful with our tour to Napa Valley and other activities we had questions on. The wine hour from 5:30-6:30 was wonderful! Our only critique was that the bed was a little small, but we enjoyed the intimacy of the hotel and historic value of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: KBJuarez
Reviews.Content: After searching many hotel web sites, I chose Galleria Park. We did not want to stay at a large hotel, but appreciate the ammenities provided by them. This wonderful hotel provided them all. It is done very nicely in an Art Deco theme. The rooms are good sized & clean with updated bathrooms , adequate sized elevators, free internet, in room coffee and refrigerators, very personable staff, a workout room, an outdoor 3rd floor terrace where you can jog or walk the dog AND NO GARBAGE TRUCKS in the middle of the night. We were able to park our SUV in a garage 1/2 block away for $30/day( no in & out tho')

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: ec92
Reviews.Content: I arrived Thur Nov 5 for 5 nights for the Titans/49ers game. First time ever in San Francisco Took Go Lorrie's Shuttle from the Airport ($15). You can take the BART, but I didn't know how or how far the stop is from the hotel w/luggage. I bought a 3 day Muni Passport + map at the airport (same level as baggage claim/cash only) for unlimited rides on Bus, train, cable car, streetcars - DOES NOT INCLUDE THE BART. It was a great deal since the hotel is located in the Center of downtown SF and close to everything. I walked a block or so to the stop and was on my way. Ask Jacob the Bellman if you have any questions - he has all the answers and always gave me great directions! I was alone for couple days and felt safe walking around at night - within reason. Yes, there are homeless ppl, but all major metro cites have homeless ppl - you are lucky if you are shocked by homeless ppl. The hotel met my expectations - clean and comfortable. Room 608 was facing the street - but not too loud and I didn't have any problem w/cellphone signal (Verizon). The room looks exactly like the pic on the website! Yes, the rooms are a little small, but that is to be expected in an old hotel. 1 of 2 elevators was out for couple days, but not a big deal - The housekeeping was adequate, but a little stingy w/the towels, I had to call and ask for extras. I did not have a flat screen TV and the A/C was hard to adjust - these are little things that didn't ruin my trip. The evening wine reception was AWESOME and nice to chat w/staff and other guests. I didn't eat in the Midi restaurant - a little froufrou for my taste, but there is plenty within walking distance! I had a nice steak dinner at Bob's Steak & Chop House in the Omni (ask for Aaron, great server who drew me a map to his favorite spots) There is a Walgreen's across the street for snacks, Pomodoro Pizza around the corner, Murphy's Bar across the street, Union Square and Chinatown are both within walking distance (and I'm lazy!) I took F Streetcar to Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, and Ferry Building - I thought it was fun to find my way around the big city! DO NOT MISS the Farmer's Market if you are there Tue, Thur or Sat - it was the most amazing thing - the fresh fruits/vegetables/local vibe and food vendors on the waterfront - I didn't feel like a tourist. Recommend the RoliRoti - Gourmet Rotisserie Chicken - the line is really long, but you can go to the front if you're just getting a lunch plate! Feel free to email me if you have any questions - I had a great trip and for $100/night, I thought Galleria Park was a pretty good value for the money and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: chgotraveler1116
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for the first time to San Francisco on an extended weekend getaway. We had such a great time. First, the hotel we stayed at, the Galleria Park Hotel, treated us very well. The staff was attentive to our needs and made the stay pleasurable. They also host a wine tasting in the early evening, which is a great way to relax after a day of sightseeing. We discovered several hidden gems such as a pizza place that delivered to our hotel room (pizza was fabulous!!) and a small wine bar a couple of blocks from the hotel which had a soothing, relaxing vibe. One of our best dining experiences was eating at one of the small stands selling seafood at the Wharf. We couldn't get enough of the fried crab sticks and clams. It is also worth taking the ferry to Sausalito and exploring. Another great experience. Overall, we would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: 4Luvmy2
Reviews.Content: This property is nicely located in the heart of San Francisco near shopping. It s nicely decoated as you would expect from a boutique property.
